Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Resigenochigen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good value for money. Close to a metro station and within walking distance to the star ferry termingal in Wan Chai. Clean nice room, large comfortable bed and a good shower. The reception is on floor 9 and quite strange with just a small deck but the room is in good condition.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room. Fair value for money”
Reviews.Author: pm2105
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JJ as part of a long trip travelling in Asia and found that it was a reasonable place to stay and fairly good value for money. The location is good (we much preferred staying on hong kong island and away from TST) and is in walking distance from various transport hubs and the harbour front. There are some restaurants nearby although the nicer ones seemed to be near the harbour front. Our room was a fair size and had two decent sized firm single beds. We were travelling as a couple but were put in twin room where we couldnt move the beds together. Most probably our fault when booking but you may want to specify if you want a double. The Shower room / toilet was glass-wall (with blinds) and you didn't feel like you had 100% privacy but it was ok for us. Check in didn't take too long and the girls on reception spoke enough English to make it quick. They were also helpful in giving us information about catching the airport bus (which we would recommend getting for the scenery on the way in/out). Make sure you catch the symphony of lights while in hk.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: hugoinlove
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in an office building, the door man (office building) is much more professional and polite than the check-in receptionist. Hotel always overcharge guest at check-in for so called authorization (consider I had already paid on booking.com), I heard number of times that guests were arguing with the rude receptionist regarding this overcharge!! very sneaky! Location wise is not bad, 5-10 minutes walk to nearby subway station. I chose the hotel primarily due to its price, but after staying there, I would not return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but very hard bed”
Reviews.Author: Wes M
Reviews.Content: As far as location and price go you can't go too far wrong with JJ hotel. The rooms are a good size for the price and are clean. The only issue we encountered were a shower drain that didn't drain fast enough! So either one minute showers or water overflowing into the room. If you like a soft comfy bed then this may not be the place for you. Our room 904 had a rock hard bed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms at a good price (for Hong Kong island hotels)”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect spot for a few nights in Hong Kong. It is in Hong Kong island, just minutes from Wan Chai station. The hotel is in an office/comercial block so when you come into the building you won't see a hotel lobby but just the building receptionist. The hotel is on floors 9-12 (reception on the 9th floor) rooms are spacious (again for Hong Kong standards) and clean. The bathroom has glass walls, but don't worry no one will see you doing your things as it also has blinds. No breakfat as they dont have a restaurant , but just by the entrance to the building there is a big supermarket and a bakery across the road where you can get some stuff to keep in the room fridge and have your own breakfast feasts. Loved the place and will return if in Honk Kong again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with reasonale price”
Reviews.Author: pohwan
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nites in this hotel during my visit in Aug 2012. Nice hotel, firm bed and clean washroom with reasonable price. HKD 700 per nite. 10 mins walk from Wanchai MTR station, 5 mins walk frm nearest tram station. You may take airport express bus A11 and stop at Stewart rd, Henessy rd. The hotel is just the behind the row of shop right opposite the bus station. Wil definitely stay at this hotel again if i'm goin to HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for HK Island”
Reviews.Author: n37077
Reviews.Content: The JJ Hotel is a rare gem of a decent reasonably priced hotel on HK island. As long as you remember to look at a map it is very easy to find from Wan Chai MTR station or the local bus routes including thebus from the airport (stop just after Wan Chai MTR). it is located in a mixed use office building so must pass a communal building reception who were very friendly. A small reception area is surrounded by the rooms. Like all HK hotels rooms are small, but there realy is no need to spend any time in the room other than to sleep. This hotel seems to sell out very quickly so check it and book it. I'd have no hesitation next time in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel”
Reviews.Author: y4nn4
Reviews.Content: Really like the location, near to MTR exit A3 and Wan Chai market. Just beside Yoshinoya restaurant. Clean bedroom. Supermarket in basement to buy all you needs. Affordable price in Hongkong. You can use bus A11 from the airport to go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: WilsonLai
Reviews.Content: Strategic location with plenty of convenience stores, banks & eateries nearby (supermarket on basement level). Wan Chai MTR station Exit A3 is only a few minutes walk away. Bus & tram stops nearby. Reasonable rates. Nice, clean & comfortable rooms. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “HORRENDOUS RUDE CUSTOMER SERVICE. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelleredensoph
Reviews.Content: Currently sat here at the JJ hotel with my sick girlfriend and the staff are absolutly obnoxiously rude. We arrived 1 week Ago and they basically told us to [--] off as we checked in 2 hours early. They seem to think there above there customers. Finally on the last day, my gf was very sick and they would not allow us a late check out just so she could rest. They didn't care and basically said its not out problem, go to the doctors. Finally, hotel currently bring rejuvenated so lots of noise 24-7. Also because if storms, hotel alarms go off in the middle of the night due to being over sensitive. Shocker....im sure you get the point

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fairly large room, smells of mildew”
Reviews.Author: nik001Sweden
Reviews.Content: JJ Hotel is situated a fair bit up Wanchai Road, which is a very busy street in Hong Kong. It's really close to Lockhart Road, with all the nightlife it offers. The room we had was a superior double room (free upgrade, which was nice). It was spacious in comparison to many other HK hotels I've stayed at. However, I don't know if it's because of the general high humidity in HK at the moment, but the room reeked of mildew. Not very pleasant, but apart from that, it was clean. Do not choose this hotel if you are not comfortable with sharing your private bathroom activities with your room mate as the toilet is only separated from the room by a see-through glass door!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Taesong
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is located in an office building, but I was positively suprised...rooms are very clean and thanks to an room upgrade mine was very spacious....the bed was extremely comfortable, small complimentary stuff like water and bathroom accessoires...location is very central, you get a good impression of hk from the first step outside the hotel and can walk to central or the ferry to kowloon Only two slight negative impressions: 1. TV only had a few programs - which should not matter too much if you are traveling in hk 2. they booked 500 hk dollars deposit from my credit card, but instead of canceling it on checkout they said they will cancel it 'one or two weeks from now' - which is not very professional and trustworthy (although I personally trust the staff which was very nice and friendly!)

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Rarisang
Reviews.Content: We are here for five nights and are so glad to have booked JJ's Hotel well in advance. There is a fantastically comfortable king size bed, excellent air con and a small, but very clean and effective bathroom. At one stage, there was only lukewarm water, but a staff member adjusted it immediately. The wi fi is good. The hotel is spread over four floors of Lucky Centre and you don't need to go to Reception at all once you have registered and paid, so there is no lobby. That's fine. There is always someone to open the door for us at ground level.There is a 7 /11 nearby for water and snacks. This part of Wan Chai is really good - full of unpretentious shops. Around the corner in Wan Chai Road are lots of traditional Chinese market shops - it's great. There's a goid busy cafe there.I think it is called Wah Hung. A total contrast to all the huge designer brand stores over in Tsim Sha Tsui in Kowloon. Wan Chai is quiet at night. It's about 10 -15 minute walk to Wan Chai MTR subway and Star ferry to Kowloon.Cabs are pretty cheap hereand comfortable and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very good ”
Reviews.Author: Ashash21
Reviews.Content: This is really a very nice and good place to stay . It's clean and tidy . Near train station . Around 5 min walking distance . A lot of restaurants around mostly 24 hours . Walking distance from time square . Wifi connection is very fast . I was worried before I come due to some reviews which I read before about this hotel . But once u try u will know what is it . U need a clean hotel near by a train and food and this is what jj hotel is .

Reviews.Title: “Does not look like a hotel”
Reviews.Author: WanRazak
Reviews.Content: Hard to find considering on the 9th floor to 12th floor belongs to the Hotel! No heater for the first day and no phone for the entire duration of stay.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located in bustling Wanchai, but not a proper Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bentatravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a big word. This place has an entrance on street level, open 24h, with 2 staff people, you get into a lift and at 9th floor there's the "hotel lobby", which is funny because it consists of a desk and a chair :) Rooms are newly furbished. Beds are horrific (I've been travelling to ASIA for 11 years and have NEVER found a mattress as hard as that. TV has less than 10 channels and works very bad; they do have DVD to borrow for free to watch. Minibar empty, but you can refill at 7-Eleven, 100 mts from hotel entrance. Overall I would suggest that only for short stopover, but you need to be fit for sleeping in their beds without waking up with backpain.

Reviews.Title: “Great value accommodation in HK”
Reviews.Author: sarahstar
Reviews.Content: Really would recommend this place if you are looking for somewhere clean, comfortable and good value. Huge bed! Great location - close to tram, metro and star ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, clean and pretty good location at a decent price for HK”
Reviews.Author: Daniel J
Reviews.Content: This hotel like many others in HK may not look much from the outside, being part of a tower block and only on the 9-12th floors, however when you get to the 9th floor the whole place is very impressive and seemed to be well run. The room was adequdately sized, came with a fridge, decent tv and a big bed. The bathroom had a glass wall, a HK quirk I think, and not exclusive to this hotel possibly. There are blinds you can pull down for privacy so it is not an issue. Location is pretty good in Wan Chai, we preferred to walk around but it isn't too far to Wan Chai station if you want to use public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel reasonably priced for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: aslimversgwm
Reviews.Content: Arriving from the intnl airport get a map from information before going through passport control - useful for finding the right metro line - there are lots. Take the airport express to Central station and find your way to the line for Wanchai station, exiting and exit 3 and turn left into main street. JJ hotel is part of an office block - Lucky Centre - with reception and rooms on the 9th floor. It is located in Wan Chai district , about 15 mins walk from Wanchai metro (tube) station. Clearly signed from the street - keep going straight on 'til you see it. Friendly reception and prompt check-in but be prepared to pay upfront + 500 HKD returnable deposit. Rooms are spacious for HK with very modern glass fronted shower room, sink and toilet. Good free wi-fi connection and nice big towels with slippers provided. Desk and easy chairs overlooking the nearby skyscrapers. Good location close to metro, buses and trams. Restaurant on 5th floor which we didn't actually use although we got a discount vchr to use if we had of done.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay on the Island”
Reviews.Author: Fran Z
Reviews.Content: 600HKD per night is cheap on the HK Island! I stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel is located in the heart of Wanchai, which is a nice neighborhood. It wasn't packed with tourists and had a local living atmosphere. The interior was on par with most 3 star hotels. My room was cleaned and towel/linen changed daily. Staff was courteous. Overall, it's a convenient base for exploring the Island and I had a pleasant impression.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Hong Kong and in an interesting area”
Reviews.Author: BlairHesp
Reviews.Content: First of all, hotels seem to be ridiculously expensive in Hong Kong, so it was a real surprise to find that this hotel was quite nice and the room was a good size. Our room was a bit cheaper as it had no windows, but this was discretely made up for by the presence of a curtain to give the illusion of a window. The local area was full of very cheap restaurants serving local food. Transport links were also good with the subway being about 5 minutes walk away and airport buses also coming along the main road a couple of blocks away. although it is worth doing your homework on which one to get, as we took a more expensive bus from the airport that dropped us a long way away, but got a cheaper one from closer heading back. There is also an interesting local market a couple of blocks to the east with all sorts happening if you can find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: mark0171
Reviews.Content: Good location in wanchai, close to train station and everything. Room is compact, modern, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Welshie22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in Wan Chai, which itself is very interesting. We loved the location (very close to an MTR station) but we weren't bowled over by the hotel. The reception staff weren't the friendliest and the night staff wouldn't even smile! That being said, the room was fine for a short stay (3 nights at this place for us). There is nowhere for luggage, so it can seem a bit tight for space. Not luxury but clean and perfectly good as a more central, budget option.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel a few years ago as I was trying to save some money on expensive hotels. This hit the spot and the rooms, beds etc were all better than the more expensive hotels I have stayed in whilst in Hong Kong. Comfy beds nice shower and free wifi. I traveled in October 2010 and not 2011 (could not go back that far on the drop down list!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Exceeded expectation”
Reviews.Author: Chandra77
Reviews.Content: Good hotel close to metro. Nice, clean but small rooms. Friendly staff. No proper reception, only a small desk manned by receptionist. Close to metro but not easy to locate as it only occupies few floors in the building and neighboring area is little shady. There is a restaurant in the floor below.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Fires72
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. I would highly recommend this place to anyone travelling solo or couples on a budget. As many have said, the hotel is located on a number of floors within the lucky building. There is a small set of stairs (no ramp) before you enter the building and free here there are 3 lifts so getting in and out of the building is a breeze. Checking times are strictly enforced so if you arrive early you will need to wait till 2pm (small waiting room on Level 11). The room was larger than I expected and everything was incredibly clean. The bed was "on the firm side" but still comfortable. I had plenty of room for luggage and the room had a safe as well. There is even a small fridge and a couple of complimentry battles of water was a nice touch. From inside the room I could not hear another sound and had a great nights sleep. While there are no dining options in the hotel there are 2 restaurants in the building and many more close by. There is also a 7Elevem just down the street and a McDonalds around the corner. The closest MTR station is Wan Chai and it's only a 5 minute walk if you don't wait at traffic lights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business Hotel but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: DracoLam
Reviews.Content: First time staying in Hong Kong island and choose to stay in Wan Chai in this Hotel. Not easy to find in my opinion, I missed the turn from MTR and got a little lost. As per other reviews, this hotel does not have a proper reception, just a office table with loads of stuff at the back. The hotel just occupy a few floors of the building (some other business takes up the floors including restaurant, supermarket, Karaoke I think). The room is pretty spacious, clean and what surprise me is the toilet with glass as wall. Totally see-through! The bed is rather comfortable and pillow is just nice for me. The surrounding is shops like any other hong kong district and to get a bite is rather easy. MTR is just 10 min walk away if you figure out and quite near Causeway bay where major shopping is available. walking will be around 15 to 20 min I think

Reviews.Title: “You have to decide if you can live without some hotel luxuries”
Reviews.Author: pepenoel
Reviews.Content: JJ Hotel is essentially a business Hotel in Wan Chai. It lacks a proper reception area, cafe/restaurant, the staff are not particularly helpful or informative and it shares its premises with other businesses in the building. On the other hand the price is lower than other Hong Kong hotels. I think it really comes down to this - do you need the amenities a proper hotel provides? The location is good in that it is close to the metro station but the area itself can be a little dodgy. Afterall, Wan Chai is the red light district of Hong Kong. Personally, I think I decided after my stay that I do need some of the amenities a proper hotel provides and the relatively lower price is not sufficient to dissuade me for future visits. The hotel staff did not explain properly that they were charging my card for the full amount plus a deposit of 500 HKD at the start. It took them a considerable period of time to remove the deposit amount after I left. The staff also were not particularly helpful in terms of sight-seeing and were not helpful in helping me find a pharmacy. The English spoken by the staff was average. The rooms were clean but were worn. The building is used for many different purposes and the lifts always smell a little smokey and have a slight sewer smell for some reason which made me gag when I took the lift up. The walls of the rooms are quite thin and you can hear your neighbours but this is not unusual for HK hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a quick stay!”
Reviews.Author: cloglisci
Reviews.Content: This is your average hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff assisted us with all of our questions. The location was good for nightlife, catching a cab or a short walk to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to wanchai mtr station”
Reviews.Author: eatshopeatshop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night here. Small room especially the toilet and shower area. But can't complain much for the price that we paid. Overall a good place to stay for the night especially for those who are out shopping and dining throughout most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “good value for price”
Reviews.Author: simplicity8318
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before going to Hong Kong and I think this hotel really gives you the best value for the price. Hotels in Hong Kong are super expensive but this is one hotel that is reasonable. You can walk to the metro station (about 10-15 mins). There are little shops outside the hotel you can buy breakfast. Its a little bit weird in that the hotel is located in a couple of floors within a commercial building, but if you're not too picky about all the amenities that a regular hotel has, then this is a pretty good deal. We had one giant bed in the room which two people can fit very comfortably in. The room and washroom was clean and modern looking. The only set back is the clear washroom walls (there are blinds in the bathroom you can draw down to cover the glass, but it isn't completely covered as there are still gaps between the blinds). If you're ok with this, then this hotel is a pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price for Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: mandafell
Reviews.Content: I have not long come back from staying 3 nihts at this hotel. The location is great being near a subway and one stop from central subway. It is very clean and modern and the room sizes are decent for hong kong standards. If you want a clean room in a good location this is for you. There are no frills or ammenities its just a good bed for the night at a reasonable price, ideal for a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great city stay”
Reviews.Author: recycling
Reviews.Content: The JJ Hotel is very modern and was a great base for our 4 days stay in Hong Kong. Our room was very clean and well equipped with modern glass bathroom. The location of the hotel is good and the subway can be reached in about 10 minutes by foot. The station for the "Ding Ding" Tram is just around the corner. The hotel therefore has a great location for all sights. Breakfast is not served at the hotel, but we liked the bakery just on the opposite of the hotel. Staff was nice and we could put our luggage in storage until our late departure in the evening. We think the JJ Hotel is a good choice and the price is fair for Hong Kong too.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Modern room”
Reviews.Author: COCOLINA1962
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the central location in Wang Chai, 9-12F of the commercial building and in this building there are a Michelin groumando awarded restaurant and the wellcome supermarket. Always doorman at the elevator. 4 fun minutes walk to the Wang Chai station. Very delicious dim sum restaurant is across the street. Very modern and the king size bed!!! Free internet. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good price, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Kanylbullen
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Simple but functional rooms with new interior. Comfortable beds. The free WiFi had good coverage and speed. Room was equipped with safety box and water kettle with coffea/tea. There is a restaurant in the building with excellent hot pots.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good room, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Jumbone
Reviews.Content: When I read other reviews complaining about small rooms here, I laugh. These people have clearly not stayed in Hong Kong before. The rooms here are HUGE compared to most hotels! Honestly, if you have enough room to open the door without it hitting the bed, you're doing well. At JJ Hotel you can see the carpet and walk around - for HK that's amazing. Not only that, but the rooms are spotlessly clean and well designed, with a good glass-walled bathroom. This isn't the Ritz-Carlton, it's a good solid three-star business hotel, and for the price it's probably the best value I've seen in the entire territory. Not only that, but though it seems to be run by a skeleton staff, they still manage to do things well. There was a minor problem with my booking and the charming Kiko on reception was able to fix it after only a few emails. I couldn't hook up to the (free, VERY fast) WiFi and within minutes two engineers were there fixing everything. Turned out the problem was my computer not their router. Embarrassing. Even the cleaner was exceptionally friendly and very apologetic about cleaning my room when I was working in it. Don't apologise, you're doing me a favour! There are nice little touches too: a huge TV, and a DVD player with a free DVD library at reception. There's a kettle and free tea and coffee too. And the location is exceptional - close to the tram, 5 mins from the MTR, 10 mins walk to the shops in Causeway Bay, right in the glorious hubbub of south Wanchai with about five hundred restaurants and cafes within a few minutes' walk. My only complaint is that there was no heating. HK was pretty chilly when I stayed, and it would have been nice to have been a little warmer when in the room during the day, as I was using it as an office for three days. If you're looking for somewhere to stay that is competently run, relatively spacious, well located, and not extortionate - while acknowledging that there will be no frills (no bar, no restaurant, no breakfast) - I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at JJ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a couple nights. The rooms are really clean. The service was great. The location was amazing. It's a great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AwfulRussian
Reviews.Content: Room was big for a Hong Kong hotel, very clean, all facilities in good condition. Good location in Wanchai. Considering quite modest price - really nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, convenient located, a real value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jacaranda06
Reviews.Content: We spent about 8 nights is this hotel in December and another 2 in January. It's located in the perfect area, closed to everything you need, and just 5 min walk from the MTR. Rooms are clean, bath has all the amenities you need, and the staff is really helpful. In January it was cold and as I contact the reception they provided immediately a portable heating. We had troubles sleeping during a weekend because some very unpolite people were walking ad talking right in front of our room and they did not care even if we asked politely that we wanted to sleep and it was 4 am. But of course this is not a hotels fault .... They do not serve any breakfast but outside you can eat where you want and prices are really good. They have a free lugguage deposit (up to 15 days than you pay 20 HK$ per piece per day). I strongly reccommend this hotel, in a place like HK it's a real value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Stavo8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at a perfect location, handy for MRT to major tourist attractions. Rooms were nice and shower and toilet were different. It had a glass wall, which I thought was awesome.It was clean and comfortable. It was our last stop on of a round the world trip and it was a great way to end it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice simple hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: Dolmen
Reviews.Content: We stay 3 nights, all I can say it is clean , simple and confortable nice rooms and very good location for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Real value for money”
Reviews.Author: travellerwee79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 06 nights in December. Very unique hotel as it is within a commercial building. Located on 9 - 12 floors and has snooker parlour, karaokes, restaurant on other floors. Was provided with free wifi daily. Room size was comfortable for us with enough space to place our shopping bags. Location is great and it is only a 5-7 mins walk to Wan Chai MTR. Lots of eateries nearby including some highly rated online as well as fashion shops. Cannot comment much on service as we only met the hotel associates during checking in and out process. If one is not too lazy, Causeway Bay shopping belt is also within walking distance of 15mins. Also has a supermarket at the basement of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mariel S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights to attend a conference at the HK Convention Center. Overall I had a great stay here :) ---- PROS: Location: It's central, within walking distance to the Hong Kong Convention Center and it's near to the MTR and tram and bus stations. Tons of restaurants and other 7/11 marts nearby. Price: The price is good considering most of the hotels in Wan Chai are pricey. There are more cheaper hostels at Causeway Bay though. But if you want a hotel, this one's really good. Room: Room (10S) was big and very clean. It has everything I need (huge cabinet, mini fridge, coffee/tea maker, mugs and spoons for coffee, hair dryer) Staff: Everyone is really nice. The housekeeping team makes sure they clean your room everyday (When I put up the "Do no disturb" sign, the reception even makes sure to call me and ask if I really don't want housekeeping to clean my room that day) Safety: There is a guard at the entrance of the building and their security cameras are all on 24/7. Went home one time around 3am and it was pretty safe. ---- CONS: Noise control: I can hear the people from the adjacent rooms using the bathroom. Water Heater: It takes awhile to get the water to the right temperature.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kim025Singapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights here. First night in Room 1105, smoking twin bed premier room . We asked for a change to a non-smoking room and the staff was very helpful and gave us 1005, premier king bed room. The layout of 1005 is very good and big and the king size bed accommodates three of us comfortably. We were given extra pillows and comforter immediately upon request. The toilet is this room has minimal glass compared to other rooms and we could easily cover a small part of the glass door with newspaper so that we do not need to use the blind everytime we used the toilet. Was abit concerned about smoke smell in the room based on some reviews but we had no such problem at all. Security is good here. The office and housekeeping staff appear to be very positive people who respond to any of our requests immediately. I love the location-Wan Chai MTR ( straight short walk away along Wan Chai road) is convenient to get to many places, Kowloon, Central, Causeway Bay, Lantau Island, Lamma island. Wan Chai is a vibrant place to stay, lively even at 11pm. The eating outlets are enormous, quite hard to choose. Love to ride on the tram (tram stop is nearby) to get to Causebay bay, admiralty, Happy valley. Walked early in the morning to Bowen road, Kennedy Road and surprisingly ended at Hong Kong Park. The garden near to the tea museum is lovely and one could get a lovely shot of Lippo building(" Koala Building) there . From there the short cut to Admiralty MTR and tram stop back to wan chai through Pacific Place is a great discovery for me. This hotel is half the price of what we paid for in Chi 314 during the initial part of our trip. It is really good value. From JJ hotel we walked straight down to gloucester road ( 7 mins) bus stop to take the A11 to the airport. Sitting at the top deck, I had a marvellous and smooth journey back to the airport as it is a very scenic ride.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: uiruson
Reviews.Content: Hotel's location is very convenient, about 10 minutes walk to Wan Chai MTR station ( exit A3 ). On your way to hotel from the MTR station you can find at least two convenient stores and many restaurants and 24 hours McDonalds. If you like to shop for electronics / video games you should visit 298 Computer Zone and Oriental 188 Shopping Centre which are located nearby. The hotel room was very new, modern and clean. The king size bed was very spacious and you also get a free wifi-internet in your room. I love the customer service they provided, the staffs were very helpful and friendly. I'll definitely come back in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Central”
Reviews.Author: KenFergus0n
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the 9th floor of a big building in central Wanchai. This should not put you off as it is clean and very well run. There are bedrooms with no windows and these come more cheaply than others, but are very spacious and fully equipped to 3 star standard. A major plus for this hotel is that it is cheaper than those around it of a similar standard. When others are putting up their rates because of local events the JJ remains excellent value - though booked out on special occasions such as for the rugby 7s. There is an excellent in-house massage service. The rooms have TV, video player and internet available.

Reviews.Title: “comfort at afordable prices...”
Reviews.Author: aquarian_India
Reviews.Content: The place is neat n clean...just walkable to wanchai MTR. Bus stand is just outside the hotel. Quiet good rooms in the busy streets of hongkong where its difficult to find space to walk even. Sleep quality was ok. Only thing u might not like is the glass bathroom but I loved that as well. They does not have any restaurant of their own but there is one in the same building. I would recomend this place to all the budgeted travellers. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryGabby
Reviews.Content: Very central location, large bed and nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: mytripbuzz
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 4 nights stay in this hotel. Location is in the heart of Wan Chai, a bit difficult to find at first especially since the hotel is located in an office building (JJ ocupies 9th to 12th floors), we walked from the MTR going to the hotel so we had to ask around. Lots of good places to eat in the area and nearby shops where you can find great bargains. About 10 minutes walk from the MRT. Loved the bed - firm and comfy. Size of the room is quite big compared to other HK hotels with the same price. Toilet & Bath is a bit funny, it's all glass, but there are shades you can pull down for some privacy. Over-all, it's good value for money and recommendable. Will stay here again given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a boutique hotel in WanChai”
Reviews.Author: Cellydaniel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days during our last trip to Hong Kong. The room was pretty spacious. The decor is clean and simple. The bed was very comfortable too. It was very hot in the summer when we went so the a/c really helped. The location is great. It was about 10 min to the Wan Chai metro station and there are many restaurants in the area. It is not easy to find an affordable hotel in Hong Kong that is not teeny tiny. We will definitely stay here again. The wifi is not great inside the hotel room but works well if you are in the lobby/meeting area. I had one problem with the receptionist though. On the second day, my key wasn't working anymore. The receptionist reswiped it and it worked. 10 minutes later, I had the same problem again. After the third time that my failed, I was pretty upset. Instead of offering to give me a new key altogether the receptionist started yelling at me and said that I must have switched the keys between the two rooms that I had booked. The other key I had worked fine so I didn't mix them up. Other than that minor inconvenience, we had a nice stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Bob_SEA2010
Reviews.Content: It is in the heart of Wan Chai, the old part of Hong Kong Island, you cannot compare it with the ones with 5 stars brand, but its location is great provided you know how to travel by bus and tram. A fair walk from the MTR, but it is safe and you will enjoy the walk especially during weekends. The best way to get to this hotel from the airport is to take the Airport Express to Central Station in Hong Kong Island and then take a taxi, (print out the Chinese address for your taxi driver) can stop right in front of the hotel. Then you can ask the hotel front desk for your further transportation needs. The room is clean, elegant size for a Hong Kong hotel room (it locates in the prime area of Wan Chai, mind the room size), sound proof rooms and very good air conditioning for the summer ! Lots of good eat around the area, peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: emem83
Reviews.Content: We got the corner room, which was very clean and peaceful. Room was a real deal for money. The location is near the mtr (most convenient way to travel generally in Hong Kong), tram (another cheap and convenient way to travel around Hong Kong island; this is our favorite to ride) and ferry (cheapest way to cross to the Kowloon side where most of the shopping is located). Also near the Hong Kong Convention Centre. Wifi didn't reach our room. But may be probable in the lounge area of each floor. Anyway, there is wifi in the bus, mtr and many places in Hong Kong, so this isn't much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, not so good location.”
Reviews.Author: jrcl
Reviews.Content: Arrived at JJ Hotel last Oct. 5. Took us a few people to ask before we finally located this hotel from the A11 Bus from the airport. I guessed it would have been easier if we arrived via MTR Airport Express from the airport. In the event that you get lost, ask somebody from other "boutique" hotels which are everywhere in this place, not from someone in the street. Even guys at nearby 711 won't be able to tell you where JJ Hotel is. It might help to ask where Emperor Group Center is, that is one big building along Hennesy Rd. (the main road) and directly behind Emperor Group Center's building is Lucky Center, where JJ Hotel is. We booked a superior room, 2 beds for four nights. The room is very clean, the bathroom with glass enclosure is a nice touch to an otherwise plain room. The beds are quite hard, which is a personal preference. So far, everything that's in this room (Rm 903) works. Only complaint is the cable TV whose channels number like, 6 and out of the 6 channels, only one is an English channel. There's a DVD machine, but you have to pay HKD 50 to "borrow" a movie from the library at the reception. If you will be out the whole day, like us, and would only be needing a shower and nice bed to sleep on at night, then this is ok. There are no hotel amenities to speak of, this is a no-frills, standard hotel. You get what you pay for and frankly, not bad for a budget hotel in Hong Kong. The only downside here is that the nearest MTR station (Wan Chai) is a few blocks away. It's NOT near esp if you are carrying massive shopping bags ALL THE TIME! While getting a cab is an option, flag down rate is HKD 20 vis a vis the MTR, bus or tram that only average between 2-5 HKD, depending on your destination. But for the love of myself (feet and arms especially) do get a cab when you think your arms and legs would like to separate from you already. Better yet, google map your hotel first before making a reservation and get those that are a building or one or two buildings/steps away from an MTR station. I guess when they say 3-5 mins walk, it may still be ok. But if it says 10-15 mins walk, that means its far! So beware. Other than the location, the hotel room is ok and if only for that, I would be staying here again. To summarize, location is a no, room cleanliness and comfort is a yes. Food? Never worry even if the hotel doesn't serve breakfast or any meals. You will never go hungry in Wan Chai. There are restaurants everywhere to suit your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location, and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: arvadadan_2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JJ for three nights in September. The hotel is easy to find. You can take the MTR Airport Express to Central and transfer to the blue line and go two stops to Wan Chai. Exit A3 and turn left out of the exit. You will be on Johnston Road. The road will split to Wanchai road, which will be on the other side of the street. Follow the addresses on the front of the build. The number will go higher as you continue down the street. Next store to the hotel will be a Japanese restaurant. Two door down from the hotel will be a laundry. The hotel is located in the Lucky Center Building. A doorman is usually their to open the door. Take the elevator up the ninth floor to the desk. We were greeted by Jeffery, who was very helpful to us. Free water is available on the 11th floor. The room was clean, very good air conditioning, cold refrig, and comfortable bed. In the basement is a grocery store. Across the street is a bakery. Some nice noodle restaurants around the corner. Wanchai street market about 10 minute walk. I would stay here again on my next visit to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Warning letter received for old stains in hotel room”
Reviews.Author: clarakhor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the peak period of Sep 2011. Our associates were regulars there. One night, we were shocked to receive a warning letter that we had to be careful with usage of the room's iron, ironing board and curtain otherwise we had to pay a fine. Upset, I went to the front desk and asked them to inspect our room as we did not damage the room at all. The iron and ironing board provided by the hotel was already worn out with old brown stains and a hole. The curtains were hidden behind the high bed board and it was impossible for me to reach, not to mention damage it. But there were old yellowish stains on them. We were offended as we did not expect by not complaining of the hotel facilities, we were blamed instead. The manager was not available after office hours. Next day, we got a box of cookies and a letter of apology from them but it already spoilt our day. Next day, we wanted to borrow an umbrella and was told had to pay deposit of hkd200 first. The Market price of a new umbrella is less than hkd50. We gave up as we were sadden by the strict regulations here. The location and hygiene is fine but the rules sucks.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Expensive Hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Albuquerque_NMGeezer
Reviews.Content: WE booked at 80USD/day based upon a combination of these reviews and the low price. I would just about ditto the previous reviewer. I found the cleaning people on the ball though the front desk was frankly a pain though I think the woman was trying to be nice-just very attentive to "ruls". First problem was a friend of my wife called from Guangzou to verify that we had arrived and left a message "tell them I called but not to call back." She simply wanted to know that we were there since international calls from a hotel are so expensive. This became a message slipped under the door to call her. Since it would be an international call the desk would not allow me to place it no matter how much I agreed to pay but I was directed to a public phone. After an hours search it was obvious that finding a public phone would be virtually impossible so I returned to the desk. Now I was directed to purchase an international phone card which I eventually found at a 7-11. I could not read the instructions on the card but she translated them for me. After this I made the call and found out what the friend's real message had been. A couple of hours and the cost of the card completely wasted, Further pain at checkout. In spite of this we would not hesitate to stay again, clean room, good housekeeping, large enough, great location, A11 bus from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Must stay hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yulianjade
Reviews.Content: Location: Wan Chai You won't go hungry. You can spot any cafe or restaurant here. You won't lose your way. Tram, buses and MTR (approx 10 mins walk) is nearby the hotel. There is supermarket at the basement. Room: Bed is so comfortable than my own bed.. LOL.. Very clean, tidy and comfortable. just nice for 2 persons... Service: Excellent. They can speak fluent English. Friendly and helpful (: I will be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “JJ hotel wan chai - Recomendable”
Reviews.Author: Le0nieChin
Reviews.Content: So far quite convenience cos walk around 5 min will be the MRT but this hotel more suitable for couple instead of family as all bath room are glass bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Top spot helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Margotjolly
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights in this small hotel. Everything was clean, the staff were very helpful. It in a great position in a very interesting part of Hong Kong - easy walking or a quick tram ride to the major spots. Bed was great and loved the bathroom. Wanchai is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: CaptnHook
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a two day stay here in May. I read through all the reviews of this hotel in Trip Advisor ahead of time so I knew what to expect. We took the A11 bus from the airport to Hennessey and Stewart Roads for $40 each; which took about 50 minutes on a Sunday morning. The hotel is only two blocks away from the bus stop. We arrived to the hotel around noon but our rooms were not ready until 2:00 pm. So we left our luggage in their storage room and went out for a walk and lunch for a couple of hours. The rooms were exactly what I expected. Decent size for HKG standard, large (but very firm) bed, free wireless internet, in-room mini-fridge and digital safe, and two complementary bottles of water. The AC in my room was putting out nice cool air. But the one in my friend room was not so much. Being it was Sunday afternoon we figured just let the reception know now and hopefully someone will come in to take a look at it the next day. Surprising enough a maintenance man stopped by few minutes later and fixed it. It turned out it was the AC unit setting of the floor in circulating mode; pumping warm outside air into the room. In no time that was fixed. I stocked up on beverages and snacks from the grocery store in the basement, the in-room mini-fridge came in handy. Public transportation in the area is good. Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR stations are both within walking distance. After the laser show in TST, we were thinking about taking the STAR Ferry back to the hotel. But we didn’t because I did not know where the ferry would drop us off on the island. But it turned out Wan Chai Ferry Terminal is only few blocks away from the hotel. Both Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR stations are within walking distance. Overall I like this hotel and will stay here again on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Decent sized room in a tiny hotel + great location”
Reviews.Author: JKnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel acts like a speakeasy - hard to locate if you're not actively looking for it on a busy street. It sits several floors above in a mixed use building that houses a supermarket in the basement - conducive to many a trips downstairs for snacks and water! Our room was large with a view of slummy-looking apartment buildings. Apparently more common in Asia than elsewhere, this room had a see-through bathroom. Prior to arriving, we had been traveling for several weeks through Japan and other parts of China, so when we got here, it was not a shocker anymore. I think we Americans can learn a thing or two from Asians about being comfy in our naked bodies. Anyway, this hotel is also quite close to a metro station - we most of our sightseeing by metro so we were glad to be so close to one. There is also no shortage of restaurants nearby with dim sum and other delicious options. I highly recommend this hotel as your base.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price you pay”
Reviews.Author: Uyaffe
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via recommendations from tripadvisor. The price is low, and you get alot for that. There is no lobby, the hotel is 4 floors from a 20 floors building. The front desk girls weren't very nice, but we didn't need their help. The room is small, but it is enough. In the room we had a super large king size bed- very comfortable, TV with english channels, free WIFI, and glass walls shower.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a 2-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SpirosK81
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was a bit hard to find (the taxi drivers didnt know about it, thankfully we had printed a map beforehand) and it is close to a very "Seedy" area (full of strip clubs etc), it is actually VERY GOOD!! Located at the middle floors of a skyscraper (with good restaurants in the same building too), within walking distance from Wan Chai Metro station (and if you are a bit of a walker, like us, within Causeway Bay too (less than 30 minutes)) and with staff that genuinely tries to help I think it was good to book here. The only downside was that the air conditioning unit needed a bit of a cleanup (but that's to be expected at 2-stars).

Reviews.Title: “All that you need”
Reviews.Author: ClarindaC
Reviews.Content: Don't let the small entrance throw you off. This hotel has all that you need - huge glass bathroom (shower only), spacious and clean room, huge bed, - minimalistic without looking like a cheap roadside motel. The staff that greeted us was also very friendly. Hotel only has several rented floors in and office bldg so if you're looking to hang around your room all day you might be missing out on the extra amenities most other hotels offer. Only minor complaint - the bed is hard as a rock! If you're not ok sleeping on "firm" mattresses, you might want to reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Been there and it was ok”
Reviews.Author: rbb71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in JJ several times already and in all those time i did not expect a lot so whatever came my way, I was pleasantly surprised. Except this one time when i left an electronic item in the room when i checked out. I came straight from the hotel to the airport and then to my place in Jakarta. The moment I unpacked I noticed that i did forget something. I called JJ right away and the staff seemed unhelpful and nonchalant. He told me to call back in 20 minutes and after that he said that no one found anything, which I found rather unbelievable. To think that piece of electronic is only one part of another piece, it would be useless without the other. Not only does this ruin the staff's credibility it speaks of their stupidity to keep such a useless item.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: sge1899ev
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the JJ Hotel in Hong Kong. The rooms are nice, not huge but sufficiently spacious, clean and the bed was just great. Great: + location (it's just 350m away from MTR), in the heart of Wan Chai + clean and nice rooms + friendly staff + reasonably priced Negative: - it was a little bit COLD at night in the room (yeah, even Xianggang can have cold nights) and there were no additional blankets available, coz other guests already claimed them - room service was okay but not great Overall: Nice hotel, great location and good prices. I would go there again :)

Reviews.Title: “JJ on Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: Ivanawee
Reviews.Content: Hi! I really liked JJ, booked it based on the rewievs here and was not regretting it at all. Liked big bed (slept totaly awsome), liked open bathroom - which can be also closed. Spent there just 4 nights and have no complaints at all. If you feel cold, turn off the air conditioner and adjust it on warm (as someone mentioned that there`s to cold). The truth is that everywhere is extreamly cold couse of air conditioners, even taxis! For this money you don`t find better accomodation there on Hong Kong Island and with such really great position. For girls - nearby is a beautiful, gigantic shopping mall called The Times Square. On the 13th floor you can find very cool bar&restaurant with perfectly nice staff. It is called SML. I loved it and went there on foot which took about 15 min. Kindly advise, book JJ!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: KTMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Good: Good value for money Location is great, near local market, money exchange, MTR Bad: Smokiness in room despite requesting non smoking room Very small corridors and reception area (difficult to move the suitcases). Does not look like a nice (traditional) hotel, more like some dodgy operation

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, probably the best mid-ranger near Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: El_Predator
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double room to myself, very spacious and clean. Maybe even a bit too spacious cos felt a bit lonely at times in such a big room alone and the decor isn't that homey. Room has everything you need. Only 7 mins walk to Times Square and 5 mins to MTR. Only 10 mins taxi from Lan Kwai Fong - very useful if you score a one night stand. Eateries and laundry just next door. Highly recommended. Not expensive but not cheap either - mid-range.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay - nothing stands out, but nothing horrible”
Reviews.Author: songseven
Reviews.Content: The last time I went to HK (in 2010) I stayed at Charterhouse Causeway Bay (which was actually on Wan Chai Rd.) and I would have to walk pass JJ Hotel every time I walked to or from Wan Chai MTR station - and it was quite a long walk. So, for this trip, I checked out the rates and reviews of this hotel and I was quite pleased with what I read - inexpensive yet convenient and clean. I made a booking for 2 superior rooms (for me and my girlfriend and my friend's couple) for 2 nights. I read a lot of review about this hotel so I was quite aware of what to expect - it being 4-floor rented space in a commercial building with little to no service in the hotel. I was only hoping for a clean and comfortable room near the MTR station. And that was pretty much what I got. No more - no less. My Grades: Room: B The room's as spacious as most business hotels in Hong Kong (meaning not very big, only enough space for 2 mid-size luggage). The room we got was very clean, with good light from the outside and no cigarette smells. As is with other new business hotels in HK, it has a glass wall bathroom in order to make the room appear more spacious. Some may find that sexy while others may find it a bit awkward (you can bring down the shades though). One of the cons is that it has no bathtub - not good if you do a lot of walking and want to soak your feet in a warm water. Another major flaw I found in my room is that I couldn't properly shut the door of the shower area so I had to be careful not to make the bathroom floor too wet. *There was supposed to be a free in-room wi-fi connection, but I couldn't find the signal in my room at all. That doesn't seem to be the case in other rooms though. (FYI my room was 1107) Service: B- No bellboy. No concierge (that I could find). But the staff was very helpful; they responded very quickly to my emails prior to my trip and was very willing to answer any of my questions. You can rent DVDs from the hotel (2 DVDs / night for free) and there's 24-hour room service. *Since I couldn't find wi-fi signal in my room, I had to go out to the hallway to use the internet. I guess they saw me just standing there on the CCTV, they sent a maid rushing to me to see if I there was any problem or if I got myself locked out. I find that kind of nice. Facilities: C Since it was only rented floors, the hotel didn't offer anything extra. There was a meeting room on my floor and I think they have a business center. That's about it. Location: B+ I chose this hotel because I thought it'd be much closer to the MTR station than my previous hotel. Granted it's within a 5-10 minute walk, it's still farther than I'd expected. And being on Hong Kong island might not be ideal for casual tourist who visit HK for the first time since retails on this side usually cater local people and not a lot of them speak English. Aside from that, the hotel's quite convenient for a short trip; you have a supermarket in the basement of the hotel, surrounded by dozens of convenient stores, drug stores and good food vendors. Comparing to other hotels in the area: JJ Hotel is probably the only hotel near Wan Chai MTR under $700/night. Other hotels in the area are more traditional business-hotels like Charterhouse or Novotel - both farther to the MTR. Overall: B JJ Hotel's only good for a short trip to Hong Kong for people who's quite familiar with the city already. If you're already familiar with the city and you have specific purposes for your trip, or if you want to get in touch with the hectic local life, you might give this hotel a try. But if this is your first visit and you're expecting a pleasant vacation, try the hotels on Kowloon Island.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modest room at a good price (for HK)”
Reviews.Author: wkyken
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay there, and I must say I was impressed. The room is clean and comfortable, and I had a king-size bed. The wireless internet delivered flawlessly and is complimentary in the room. I should point out that the bathroom is surrounded by glass, so depending on your circumstances, you may want to lower the blind. Reception is on the 9th floor of the Lucky Centre, with rooms on floors 9-12. It's in Wanchai, a couple of blocks east of the hallmark trams on Johnston Road. As long as you remember it's a 2-star hotel without a bellboy or extensive customer service, you'll be fine. The staff were very friendly and professional. I'd stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Nasution
Reviews.Content: It's my 4th stay. Everything is as it is, clean, spacious room, close to everything. However, the room is with glass walled bathroom. Maybe not suitable for modest people. Still though, it's a good choice for business or shopping trip. It doesn't have room service, but there are some restaurants in the same building and lots of close by eateries. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Jason313
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and was the same as the photos. The location is closest to the Wanchai MTR station. The Wellcome grocery and Yoshinoya restaurant are literally at the ground floor of the hotel. A Cafe de Coral is nearby. A nice bonus is the 5 gallon drinking water at their lounge area where you can refill your own bottles. Oh, and free wifi. But there was a problem with the internet provider on our second night. The elevator was quite small. The reception area is only a desk with a couple of chairs. Don't expect a lobby here. The bed is unusually high. The water took a while to heat up. There is only shower here and no bath tub. The bathroom is encased in glass so you have to be an intimate couple.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Busen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location - it's only 5-10 minutes from both tram and metro stations. There are plenty of shops and restaurants around and even the Causeway Bay is easily reachable on foot. The size of the room was quite ok, a bit on the smaller side, but that's Hong Kong. Our room was on the back side of the hotel, facing the construction site, but we didn't find it noisy (we were on the 9th floor). The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The WiFi internet is free of charge. The bathroom is transparent, with glass walls. No international TV channels, but you won't have time for watching TV in Hong Kong anyway. Good restaurant (Megan's Kitchen) in the same building, with great hot pot and cheesecake (guests of the hotel get a voucher for either two free beers or two free cheescakes). The restuarant was crowded in the middle of the week, so it seems that their hot pot is very popular among the locals. The room service has a food from that restaurant. If you're in Hong Kong for a lot of sightseeing, this hotel is a great choice with an excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room, strange entrance”
Reviews.Author: Jens70
Reviews.Content: I first wasn't sure when I entered the hotel, and had to go up to the 9th Floor to check-in. The hallway looks cramped, and I was ready for the worst. But the room is bright, modern and spacious. Internet is free, and apparently the hotel houses the best hot pot restaurant in HK (and guests get a voucher for 2 free beers and 2 free cheese cakes). That I was next to a busy construction site is something that I guess we can try to ignore.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Clean but don't expect any sleep here”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanypurple
Reviews.Content: In terms of location and price, I could not fault this hotel. As other reviewers have noted it is in the heart of all the action in Wan Chai, only 10 minutes from Happy Valley and close to the Metro/tram links which takes 15 minutes to Central. The decor of the room is modern and clean and the hotel has all the facilities you would expect of a modern city hotel. However we had real issues sleeping at night. We expected noise from outside given that it was Hong Kong (there is a building site out the back be warned) but there was so much noise and banging coming from within the building it kept us all awake - even in separate rooms. We did ask to move but that didn't prove any better. Not sure if it was the hotel making the noise or from other businesses. Also the staff although polite, could be more efficient and friendly. They didn't seem to go out of there way to help or offer assistance when it came to booking taxi's or recommending places / giving advice. Not sure I would stay here again as much as I liked it, Hong Kong is a great city which you need all your energy for so at least one good night's sleep in 4 days would have been welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: 351C
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that consists of a number of clean, modern, comfortable, relatively compact rooms on the 9th, 10th and 11th floor of an office building in the Wan Chai district of Hong Kong. It's not a full service hotel by any stretch of the imagination, it's just the rooms, and a few compact common areas - no pool, bar, restaurant or other services. The rooms include free internet access. The small office staff is professional. There's a very good restaurant, Megan's Kitchen, on the 5th floor, open for lunch and dinner. It's well known around Hong Kong for its quality, spicy Asian dishes, so try to eat there at least once. So why stay here? Value & Location. The rooms are very comfortable and clean; the beds are the most comfortable I've experienced in any hotel - my back was happy after the first night. The location is very good too, five blocks or so off the water, nestled in an area with everything one needs - banks, money exchange, coffee shops, restaurants, clothing stores, food stores, pharmacies. If you've traveled a lot, you'll quickly recognize the neighborhood-wthin-the-city feel of the area: calm, friendly, and easily negotiated. When I say calm, I mean: A notch or two below full-frenzy Hong Kong, rendering a neighborhood one can actually function in without much fatigue setting in. A few notes: The nearest MTR station ( the Hong Kong subway / Metro) is Wan Chai and it's a 2-1/2 block walk to the JJ if you take the A3 exit from the station. Not too bad if you have compact luggage with wheels. If you don't, it's better to take a taxi from the Hong Kong "Central" station, noting that taxis in Hong Kong are inexpensive. If you need a China visa, the China Resources Office is just five blocks away, takes about 15 minutes to walk there. Hong Kong's SoHo and other high-end tourist areas are 1-2 metro stops away. But you can also take a tram, a taxi, or even walk to these areas without much effort. Summary: If you're a seasoned traveler in search of value and simplicity, this is a good choice. If this is your first trip to the area and plan to spend most of your time exploring rather than watching TV or drinking in a hotel bar, this is also a good choice - again, because the rooms are clean and modern and the location is central to everything. If you need a full service hotel with glitz and glamour, this is not where your should be. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “simple great bed”
Reviews.Author: ComoxLib
Reviews.Content: Good location and like alot of Hong Kong places is a mutli use building with really good restaurant, engineers, archietects, advertising agent, social club, majong club, etc on other floors. Really extensive food shopping supermarket in the basement. Overlooking a noisy ugly building project with huge crane, but Hong Kong is basically a building project ongoing so this cannot probably be avoided generally . Two door men downstairs are always friendly and helpful as were staff when we checked in. Any request promptly responded to. internet access fast and good. Room is great. Well designed and good cleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: playmix
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in one of the skyscrapers in Hong Kong. Central loaction, near to shops and restaurants and also close to MTR station from where you can get to all the city highlights. The shuttle bus to airport just stops one block away. Wi-fi works excellent and is free of charge. Sevice was great, free tea and coffee in the room. excellent bathroom with the glass wall facing the room!

Reviews.Title: “NIce, Clean & Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: adityahalan
Reviews.Content: Dear All, I stayed here for almost 9 day and it was a comfortable stay. The room was clean , and proper. It was bit small, but ok for 2. The location is perfect as its in the heart of city with complete access to all nightclubs, restaurants, shopping, MTR.

Reviews.Title: “Bed is too high. No privacy for the toilet.”
Reviews.Author: Flipzter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in JJ Hotel last October 15-19 with my friend. The staff were all nice to us. JJ Hotel, doesn't look like a hotel - it's more like a motel/hostel to me. The receptionist is located in the 9th floor. But when you get inside the room, it is very nice and everything is like new. The view from the hotel is not so nice. So don't bother looking outside the Hotel. The only thing I hate with JJ Hotel is that the toilet doesn't have a privacy and the bed is too high. But the WIFI in the room is superb! When travelling the most important thing is the WIFI - their internet connection is very fast and reliable too! Overall, it was a pleasant stay in Hong Kong. But I am willing to try other Hotels when I return in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “I made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: dosmadghie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 6 days. As with previous reviews, I can say that the location is very good. A short walk to Wan Chai MTR Station, a grocery at the lower ground floor of the same building, and native restaurants are pretty near. Everyday our room was kept clean without any request and the receptionist was very apologetic when he forgot to provide us with our complementary water. Amenities are complete for a hotel of that level. I can say that it is worth every penny that we spent for that place. It is important to note though that I did not rate service a perfect five. It is because the receptionist who attended to us when we checked in was not very hospitable but the others are all smiles all the time. All in all we had a very good experience with this hotel and would recommend it to my friends and family and will even consider staying there again next time we fly to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, near subway, large room, free wifi, good value”
Reviews.Author: Junbug4
Reviews.Content: After traveling S. Korea & Japan, staying in timeshares, bargin and top notch hotels, the JJ Hotel in Hong Kong was about the best we had been in. Its location in Wan Chai was convenient to the subway and other interesting sites on Hong Kong Island. The deluxe room was large, bright and the king size bed was very comfortable. The hotel uses 4 floors in a high rise building that had 24 hr. doorman. Check-in area was a bit cramped, but worked. The next time I'm in Hong Kong, I'll stay at the JJ Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible service, low quality rooms and amenities - would not return.”
Reviews.Author: olouie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days on my last trip to HK. We booked it seeing all the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, but I have to say that we were very disappointed. The hotel's location is good, but that is about the only thing going for it. This might be a nice summer hotel, but in the winter its pretty bad - hotel rooms are drafty and the a/c cannot be turned lower. As there is NO HEAT in the hotel it gets very cold. I got sick the first day and had a hard time recovering given the thin blankets and cold a/c that is on all the time in the hallways and drifts in to the rooms. The staff is not well trained, provides different answers to different customers. Note they repeated told us they did not have extra blankets or sheets - kind of gross really. I have stayed in many budget hotels around the world and although the JJ looks nice and modern its really near the bottom of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best bed I've ever slept on”
Reviews.Author: little_ostow
Reviews.Content: JJ Hotel was a surprise find, located in the heart of Wanchai and within walking distance to Causeway Bay, teamed with very affordable rate, free WiFi, clean and spacious room (spacious by HK standard), making it a real bargain. To top it all, the king size bed was probably the best and most comfortable bed I've ever slept on! To those who are concerned about the traffic noise from Wanchai Road, well, don't, I can hardly hear the buses from the 10th floor room, and being a light sleeper, it was a bonus. I will definitely return to this hotel again when I pass by Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Very good price for Hong Kong Island”
Reviews.Author: filipino_chino
Reviews.Content: Very big room and for around £50 - you cannot really go wrong! Not even that far from LQF A very good place for a couple of nights, I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dutchman-nl
Reviews.Content: Somewhat hidden gem in the middle of Wan Chai. Located on 2 of the higher floors of an office building, you have to look good to find it (in spite of the signboard at the entrance), as it doesn't look like a hotel on street level. Small but very airy, modern rooms with great beds. A surprise is formed by the glass walls of the bathroom, which have the effect that the room looks at first bigger then it is. For privacy minded guests roller blinds for these walls are provided (but of course the room looks smaller when these are lowered!). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and were very disappointed that no room was available for a longer stay when such was needed because of canceled flights.

Reviews.Title: “worth staying”
Reviews.Author: enyakiz
Reviews.Content: the hotel is right in the middle of hongkong, near to almost everywhere, most recommemnde hotel to stay id stay, economical, clean and like i said near to everywhere

Reviews.Title: “BUGS and Smell of sewage”
Reviews.Author: Energypb
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and thought it be a great place, but WRONG my roof was covered with small little NAT like flying bugs and the room smelled like raw sewage. I went and told the desk and all they said that they can spray the room with bug spray, I told them Not wile i am in the room as it is deadly they said "Oh yea".. All they could say was "Nothing we can do we are full" just to say I would not suggest this place to anyone who really. The Room it's self with out the smell and bugs is a nice room over all for HK and the price, but i guess if you like cheep and the smell of sewage and don't mind shearing the room with 1000000 small flying guests then it is a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “The good value for the price, but stay focused not to pay more”
Reviews.Author: MissIssippi23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is rather good for the price you pay. It's clean, big room, it has all the necessary amendities, fast check-in/check-out. The bus stop where you can take a bus to the airport is very near - only cross the road and walk through one block of flats and you will get the place. The location is ok, not far from the Central. The neighbourhood restaurants are cheaper than in the centre or other popular tourist area. I checked the Wanchai computer market (3 mins walking from the hotel). Reasonable prices for all the computer stufff. I really loved it. I wish I could have more money to buy more gadgets. My turn-offs about the hotel: 1) They charge the deposit money from the credit card twice, and return very slowly. In my case I needed to leave the deposit 3 times, once when I booked the hotel on the internet, then while checking it to hotel, and the last time when I was checking out. The overall deposit amount was the same as the whole price I paid for the hotel. I really recommend you to leave cash as a deposit to avoid overpaying and extra money transfers from your credit card. 2) Another situation that disappointed me the most was when I used the internet in the hotel's business centre (the small room with 2 computers actually). I spent there only 1 hour but they charged me for 2 hours. When I logged out from the computer, the receptionist lady promised to fill the file with the time spent in internet by herself. My mistake was that I signed the file without ending time stated and she wrote the time she wished. Be smart, don;'t repeat my mistakes. Overall, the hotel is good, I enjoyed staying there, but the mentioned ocassions spoited the whole impression.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of days while we were in Hongkong. We loved this hotel. The best thing about it is the transparent glass between bathroom and bed room (ok some people may hate it). Apart from this the location is good. Its in the Hongkong Island. There is free internet connection. The room has all the basic amenities. However, there is no breakfast service. But there are a lot of restaurants in the nearby. Also on the top floor of this hotel is a disco. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced hotel, but the rooms smell horrible”
Reviews.Author: Surmang
Reviews.Content: The JJ Hotel is located in Wan Chai and is only a 6 or 7 minute walk to the nearest MTR. The location is quite good. There are plenty of little eateries on the streets near the hotel. The hotel looks fairly new. It is quite different than other hotels as it is just 4 floors inside of a large building called the Lucky Centre. Reception is on the 9th floor and the receptionist was quite nice and friendly. The hotel was very clean and the room size was quite good for HK and for the price we paid (around $65USD for a standard room). The carpets were clean, there was a small desk with a flat screen TV with a DVD player and the room had a refrigerator and a safe. Reception has quite a collection of DVD's that you can use for free. The rooms also offer free wireless internet. Once we walked into the room, despite it looking clean, it smelled absolutely horrible. It was bad. The smell came from the bathroom and was a mixture of sulfur, mold and sewer. The smell was intense. Keeping the bathroom door closed helped some, but we never really got over the smell. We put up with the smell since we were out in the city from 9am until 11pm...we just used the room to sleep in. The bathroom is very interesting as it is a glass, see-through enclosure in the room. There are blinds throughout the bathroom that you can pull down, but there is still plenty of places that are not covered by the blinds. If you are traveling with someone you don't know very well, this could be very awkward. Overall, the JJ is a good value hotel in a great part of the city. If they could find a way to get rid of the smell, I would have rated it "Very good" instead of "average".

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGreg
Reviews.Content: We decided last minute to stay in HK for the weekend (we are currently working on the mainland) & most hotels were pretty expensive. We decided to give JJ a try based on the reviews & our knowledge of the Wan Chai area. We arrived at about 7pm & there was a single member of staff on 'reception'. We were given our room key & saw that this was a twin & not a double as requested. We were told that there were no other double rooms available, but we could pay $300 to upgrade to their premium room. She kindly showed us this room but it was simply a twin with the beds pushed together. We decided paying $300 to sleep in a room with the beds pushed together was not worth it so decided to stick with our original room. They had cunningly put fixed beds in the room & there was a random wooden bedside table in between the two beds. In the end we managed to manoeuvre the mattresses so that we could sleep next to each other - why they have twin rooms that can't be made into doubles I don't know, a sneaky money making exercise perhaps?? The room was relatively clean, but the bathroom had a strong sulphurous odour to it, we had to leave the door open with the a/c on high to get rid of the smell! The location is ok, you are walking distance to Times Square & the MTR station but it did feel a bit random not being in a conventional hotel! Another issue we had was having a very noisy generator to listen to throughout the night (fortunately I had packed sleeping tablets!). Then in the morning there was the pleasant sound of the construction site outside! I don't think this is a very good hotel, service was poor & the rooms were pretty basic. There are definitely better hotels in Hong Kong for the same price if you shop around on the various hotel websites around these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in the heart of Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: ian-from-oz
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for an extended stay over Easter. The rooms are comfortable and clean with the only challenge being the glass walled bathroom. There are tea and coffee making facilities and bottled water every day. Just ask the lady who cleans the rooms if you need anything else e.g. extra soap, toilet paper etc. We had a list of things to see and do and generally spent most days out. The hotel is close to the Wan Chai MTR and the nearest tram stop is about a block away on Johnson Rd. We caught buses within a few minutes walk to Aberdeen and Stanley. There are a number of bakeries nearby for breakfast fare and the supermarket in the basement of the building has all you need to make your style of tea or coffee or have a cold beer or glass of wine at the end of the day. There are restaurants galore in the area catering to all tastes and price ranges.

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: MrWah
Reviews.Content: Has been a great place to stay, just a ten minute walk from Wan Chai station, through some interesting places in the district. Great if you want to head into the City, or over the river on the Star Ferries. Lots of little shopping places within a few blocks. Great for a solo traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: santaSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay when you're out and about the whole day and need somewhere clean and comfy to sleep. I dont think you'd find anything cheaper and cleaner in Hong Kong especially if you're staying just a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “A highly recommended place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jap327
