Reviews.Content: This is our first time staying in this place, having managed to obtain a very good deal back in July last year. Although it looks relatively unremarkable from the outside, being situated inside a multi-purpose building, called Lucky Centre on 9-13 floors, we were amazed by the standard of our room on the 12 floor, with free WiFi and complimentary bottles of water daily. It was quiet, clean and comfortable with an enormous super king-size bed. It is ideally located in the heart of Wanchai district, with easy access using the A11 Airbus. The Star Ferry, MTR Trams, Buses and the Royal Hong Kong Yacht Club are all within easy walking distance. There is an abundance of good and cheap places surrounding the hotel to eat. In particular, we would recommend the Pattaya Food Court & BBQ diagonally opposite to the hotel, where there is no Service Charge and you can bring your own beer! The JJ Hotel is a superb value for money place to stay in Hong Kong, which we have thoroughly enjoyed and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rielly62
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean one small mark on a curtain but big deal. The room like many of this price was small but more than adequate. Food was very nice in and well priced in the restaurant, 2 courses for 100 HKD and 2 free beers thrown in was good. Free internet was also good. I will stay here again on my way back through Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, good location at great value”
Reviews.Author: xrayboosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our honeymoon before heading on to bali (were most of our money was spent!). The location is good, only 10min walk to the local metro station. The room was very clean and tidy and suited our needs as our 'base'.

Reviews.Title: “Great base from which to explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: UKRatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the JJ Hotel in March. The hotel has an ideal location on Wanchai, Hong Kong island close to 2 MTR stations and the Star Ferry pier. Ideally located for seeing Hong Kong, much preferred the HK Island location to Kowloon. Hong Kong is wonderful, we could have easily stayed another 2 nights and not run out of new things to do and see. The hotel is clean and well equipped with comfortable rooms that are a decent size. Would highly recommend the Winter Steam Pot Restaurant, 9-13 Heard Street, Wanchai for dinner or a dim sum brunch – just across the road and left from JJ, excellent food and staff.

Reviews.Title: “At $60 per night, this is a great hotel to stay in Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: ilocanotraveller
Reviews.Content: I paid $60 (2,800 Philippine Pesos) for a night's stay in JJ Hotel. Since the hotel occupies only 4 floors of a high-rise building (other levels have mahjong clubs and offices), I did not expect much. The elevator going to the 9th floor (reception area) was tiny; and the reception itself looked like a small office--manned by just one person. However, when I entered my room, I was pleasantly surprised with what I saw. The room was spacious (at more expensive rates, I've been in way tighter rooms in Macau and Tokyo). The bed was big. Large flat screen TV with DVD player. Small fridge and mini-safe. And most important, Free WI-FI! What a bargain! The see through glass restroom was not a big issue since I travelled alone, but I think it would be if you travelled with a friend. However, if you don't want to be seen taking a shower, you can just pull the curtain down. The hotel is located in Wan Chai district. There is a Wellcome grocery store in the basement. Mcdonalds, Burger King and Starbucks are not across the street, but they are close by. The nearest MTR station (Wan Chai Exit "A") is 7 minutes away. If you're on a budget in Hong Kong island, but you want to have a comfortable bed, a spacious room and free wifi, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and a good location, couple of tweaks would take it to the next level”
Reviews.Author: wwxc
Reviews.Content: Great location Mediocre View Carpet was a little dingy but bed was clean Poorly designed bathroom privacy Great service Wifi was very weak in the room, biz center was fine Paid $50 a night, which was a good value in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Hotel, clean and close to the action.”
Reviews.Author: McbainUK
Reviews.Content: We had two stays at this hotel. 12-19 Nov and 4-6Dec. The hotel is quite easy to miss as it occupies 3 floors of a building that has several other businesses. We grabbed a taxi from the Airport Express terminal at Central. The taxi knew the area so we found it easy enough. The building has friendly security staff who will open the door for you and call you a lift. As for the hotel itself. Each floor, reception and the two rooms we stayed in were all very clean. The staff in reception were friendly and helpful enough (They stored some of our belongings until we returned from main land China). Apart from check in and check out we had no need to go to the reception so that was the only contact we had. The rooms themselves were nice enough. Free internet was useful. Tea and Coffee were provided. The first room we stayed in was by the lifts so i could get a little noisy at times but only briefly. The other room was away from the lift so was lovely and quiet. The bed was nice an comfortable but they could do with some better pillows. The shower was really good but again they could do with some better towels. The laundry service was very expensive (as hotels always are) but if you go out of the front extrance and then two door to the right there is a really cheap laundry service. I recommend contacting the hotel directly as we got a much better price than quoted on other websites. You get a free voucher for a drink or a pudding in the restaurant downstairs. I wouldn't recommend it though, it was the worst meal we had the whole holiday. For a good cheap meal try Temple Street Spicy Crab in Kowloon (it's basic to say the least but the food was amazing).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: RVEM
Reviews.Content: JJ Hotel was the perfect hotel for our 2 day trip to Hong Kong. Clean simple rooms in a great location. Breakfast wasn't included but there are plently of places close by to grab something, nice bakery a few doors along.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Birdistheword
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 days which was more than enough. The room was smallish and really cold especially during night time. They charged me a deposit on arrival that was about the same size as the payment for the stay. We also found some pubic hairs in our bed! We had reserved a non-smoking room and still received a room in a smoking floor. The bed was insanely hard! I have never slept in a bed so uncomfortable! The location of the hotel was ok. Along a quite busy road and near some shopping sites.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Gsquard
Reviews.Content: Room is quite small, looks even smaller with that huge king size bed. Decide yourself if you like the glass walls of the bathroom/wc or not. yes, there are blinds :) Bathroom had a very weak ventilation, towels couldnt dry; dumpy smell in the room because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: kermy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the JJ Hotel in the Premier room. The room was a great size, king size bed, even though the bathroom has glass all round, you are still able to have privacy, just roll the blinds down. The location we thought was great, close enough to the MTR, buses and trams. The one thing we loved about the area of the hotel was the trams and bus services, it didn't matter what bus or tram you get, you just hop off at Hennessy & Johnston Road. Plenty of restuarants at your finger tips, Causeway Bay is walking distance, and also there is a supermarket under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Going down the drain - very quickly”
Reviews.Author: wanderlusted03
Reviews.Content: This hotel is going down the drain very quickly. I asked for a non-smoking room and because it was fully booked they just shoved me into a room that reeked of cigarette smoke. I called to complain and they did nothing to fix it. They simply said "we are fully booked sorry". This is disgusting behaviour. Just letting you know this hotel is actually just four levels with about 8 rooms per level. Not very big at all. The bedlinen had stain marks on it and a small rip too. Even when it was changed the "fresh" bed linen still was not clean. If you are expecting clean bedsheets then go somewhere else. Furthermore they do not change bedsheets regularly. In fact I only had my bedsheets changed once during my stay. Finally, this hotel is located directly above a Mahjohng Parlour and above it is a Karaoke bar. So it can be quite noisy and attracts a mixed crowd. I also noticed on each floor two rooms are located right next to the lifts. So I imaging it would be extremely noisy for those guests. If I had my time over I would probably not stay here again. It's a shame because I really think they are going down the drain - and they started off so well too. I would rather pay a bit extra and go somewhere else because this is definitely not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold rooms and thin blankets.”
Reviews.Author: Monarchy99
Reviews.Content: Hotel keeps the ac running really cold even in winter. They won't give out extra blankets either. I got sick bc of this and would not return here even at the cheap price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gumsan
Reviews.Content: I'd read various reviews of this hotel on other sites particularly on this site so had an idea of what to expect beforehand. It was odd to have the glass wall to the bathroom but the modest types could always lower the blinds. There was a little bit of mould on the ceiling and some of the towels were getting to be threadbare but the question one asks oneself is 'would I stay here again', and I would defintely answer 'yes'. You have what you need provided other than 'english' tea but we bought some from Marks and Spencer so that solved that. The staff are friendly and helpful. Oh, and the bed is big, a queeen size and normally hotel beds are dreadful, too hard for my liking but this one was very comfy as it has a memory foam topper to the mattress. The room is shall we say, compact but it was fine with a safe, fridge, kettle, tv, packets of coffee and chinese tea provided daily plus free newspapers and free wireless wi-fi The location was very good as it's not far from Wan Chai station and a very short walk to the nearest tram stop, $2 flat rate, pay as you leave at the front, board from the back. I expected it to be noisy so brought ear plugs just in case but our room was on the 10th floor facing the back and was qieut so earplugs not needed. We arrived late so got the taxi from Town Hall rather than lugging our bags from the MTR but the taxi driver had not heard of the hotel so make sure you tell him it's across the road from Mallory Road at it's junction with Wan Chai Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: vivacircus30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 times in the past 2 years - awesome value! Spacious room for HK standards and very clean! Modern interior, funky blind-drawing toilet!ha! Service was so so, you get a smile occasionally from the staff but doesn't really bother me! Its about a 7-10 minutes walk from wan chai MTR, can be a bit frustrating when arriving/departing with some luggage squeezing through the crowds! Supermarket downstairs and a couple of food outlets nearby you are well covered! and WIFI in the room!=) Overall, a no frills hotel - value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel, value for money”
Reviews.Author: kimsacao009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was on the cheap end, so while I wasn't expecting much, I was hoping that it would at least be clean. They were. The rooms actually look exactly like how they do on the website. The room, bed and bathroom are very large and well-serviced. I upgraded to the Deluxe room which I highly recommend as it was HUGE for two people. The room had a walk in shower as well as a bath with a second shower over it. There was also an in-room safety deposit box and a good sized closet. The bathrooms have clear glass doors with a covering that you can pull down. the location couldn't be better - right in the thick of the action, and only minutes from the MTR. It was incredible value for money, and the staff were helpful and pleasant. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Andyott01
Reviews.Content: Lovely spot, definitely made special by the staff ,the room was fine, bathroom was small and tv with many channels , discovery channel repeat! The staff were extremely helpful, would like to thank them very much and will defintely be recommending them! I would still definitely recommend this place though.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but bad service”
Reviews.Author: Kiran_2009
Reviews.Content: We chose JJ hotel for its price and location. From the airport we took bus A-11 and got off at Steward road opposite the Caltex petrol pump. The hotel is 7-8 min walk from the bus stop. Ask for Wan Chai road and it is right there. We have two small children and had two suitcases but found the walk etc very comfortable. The hotel is lcoated on 9-11 floor of Lucky Plaza and is on a busy street. It is very close to Causeway bay.....10 min walk. The Times sqaure in Causeway Bay was very beautifully done up cos of Christmas. We also walked to the ferry station, took ferry to Kowloon and then took bus to Science museum which the kids loved as it is very interactive. On our way back we saw "Symphony of lights" which is a light and sound show where 44 buildings are lit up and there is music. It happens every night at 8 pm. There are several eating places around the JJ hotel. There is KFC, Mc Donald, and a Pakistani food place just behind it. The downside of the hotel is that though they are OK with two adults and two kids checking in but they refused to give the 4th pillow, sheet or towel. They have a rule around giving only upto three items which was very strange. The bathroom as described by others is glass but that did not bother us as one of us would take the kids out while the parent would take a bath. Overall a goog hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Insanely good value - definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: MsLimLar
Reviews.Content: 'Good value' seems to imply cheap and nasty, but JJ Hotel is anything but. My partner and I stayed for a week at JJ and were stoked with the room and the staff. Price: Amazing, even with a piddly NZ dollar! The cheapest hotel I could find on HK Island by far. Location: Amazing location. Along a very busy road (plenty of local eateries, or the international fast food joints), on top of a supermarket which is really handy. Nearby stores are quite cheap for bargain hunters and there's a market nearby. A 2 minute stroll to the frequent (and cheap) trams - would definitely recommend using these, a great way to sightsee while you get from A to B. Also only 5-10 minutes to Wan Chai MRT station, plenty of buses right outside, and about 10-15 mins easy walk to the ferry terminal. Close to Central, cheapie Causeway Bay, a quick ferry to Kowloon, and a quick taxi from the Lai Kwai Fong (Central nightlife district). Couldn't be better in terms of location. The room: Clean, new, fresh towels etc each day. The glass-walled bathroom is a fun novelty - the gaps in the blinds aren't really noticable unless you're actually looking. Might want to be comfortable with your travelling partner though. The bed is huge and very comfortable, wardrobe holds a lot, even if there's not a lot of space for large luggage items. Staff: Very friendly, and helpful. JJ strikes me as a business hotel, but they go out of the way to help you with touristy questions, too. Nothing is a hassle for the staff. Restaurant: Received complimentary drinks/desserts at Megans Kitchen upon check-in - lovely restaurant, with great food. Overall: I would definitely stay here again if in Hong Kong. Also: there is a lot clearer street signage now - easy to just Google Maps the location and wander along until you find it at the corner of Malloy/Wan Chai Roads.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: iheartsc_01
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make this brief. This hotel was on the cheap end, so while I wasn't expecting much, I was hoping that it would at least be clean. They were. The rooms actually look exactly like how they do on the website. That being said, I don't know if there is a difference between "superior" and "deluxe" rooms. We booked a deluxe room, but were disappointed to find two twin beds when we got there. The problem was easily sorted out, and within five minutes we had a new room with a HUGE bed. This thing was humongous and probably could have slept a family of five. That being said, I wish the bed was a little smaller so that our suitcases could have fit more easily... it was a tiny room. The room was fine, but there were some not so great things about it, like nasty brown spots on the ceiling of the bathroom. The bathroom also got really cold even during hot showers because of a big slit where the hinges of the door meet the glass panel. All in all, it reminded me of a Japanese business hotel. No frills, but you get a clean (albeit small) room. Like my mom always says, "you get what you pay for." So, if you get a good rate (we did), go ahead and book it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Odot_Lady
Reviews.Content: This hotel occupies four floors of the Lucky Centre building, a 10 minute walk from Wan Chai MTR Station (Exit A3). It was clean and quiet, despite being on a busy street. A safe building with 24 hour security in the lobby. Other amenities included free wireless internet and complimentary bottles of water. Upon check-in, we received coupons for free cheesecake or two large beers. We had a room with a comfortable king size bed. Bathroom is transparent with glass doors. You can pull down blinds for some privacy but sometimes it was a hassle, especially when you needed to use it in a pinch. Must be careful to aways leave the a/c on when taking a shower; otherwise, fire alarm may go off. (We booked this hotel with Agoda.com - no issues).

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Chaos of Wan Chai, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: kimmi8
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just over a year old so everything is in top condition. It's not even a full hotel building since it's spread out over several floors of the Lucky Centre in Wan Chai. However as far as cleanliness, modern surroundings and room pricing...it can't be beat especially for being in Hong Kong island. You can get modern rooms in other districts but staying in Wan Chai makes you feel like you're somewhere different and not just another big metropolis. The room, bed and bathroom are very large and well-serviced. I upgraded to the Deluxe room which I highly recommend as it was HUGE for two people. The room had a walk in shower as well as a bath with a second shower over it. There was also an in-room safety deposit box and a good sized closet. The bathrooms have clear glass doors with a covering that you can pull down. So yes, your friend/partner can see you through the cracks. I traveled with a guy friend and we didn't have any issues. We turned up the TV or made sure the glass steamed up first before getting in. Wireless internet access was included free of charge. McDonald's, Starbucks, 7-11 are within walking distance. The hotel is also close to a number of food alleys, so great food was easy to find. It's not a big hotel and you may have problems finding it the first few times, but once you get a feel for the area it's easy. JJ is located within 5-10 min walk from the Wan Chai MTR station and catching taxi in front of the hotel was not a problem. I always gave taxi drivers the address rather than the hotel name, so there was never an issue getting back.

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL IN THE CROWN”
Reviews.Author: abhiash11
Reviews.Content: I would say if you are going to hong kong as a tourist this is the best place to stay in very centrally located , comfortable and affordable for the price what you pay .it is right in the heart of the city and as you come out there are tramps , metros and bus very comfortable any body from india going to sightseeing should stay here with family excellent place. and good eating joint near by a pakistani resturant at the back of the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Roberts69
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a few hotels in Hong Kong over the years and having lived in Hong Kong for 18 months I feel I'm quite well qualified to comment on accomodation in this amazing city. The JJ Hotel is not a big glamorous hotel as it is spread over floor 9 and 10 of the Lucky Centre in Wan Chai on HK Island. However as far as rooms and service goes it's excellent. The rooms and beds are very large (most HK hotel rooms are like cupboards with a bed in) clean and well serviced. My room had a huge walk in shower as well as a bath with a second shower over it. Also there were tea / coffee facilities, an in room safety deposit box and a good sized wardrobe. Wireless internet access was included and worked without problem for the whole week I stayed at the JJ. The hotel is located in easy walking distance (10 minutes) of the Wan Chai Convention Centre and is about a 5 minute walk from the Wan Chai MTR station. Also within easy reach of the hotel are supermarkets (there's one below the hotel), McDonald's, coffee shops and pharmacies. Also within walking distance (1Km) is the lively bar and restaurant area of Wan Chai. Make sure you have the address with you as I got a taxi back to the hotel on 3 occassions and the taxi driver did not know the hotel. Pick up a hotel name card at reception and keep it with you at all times and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual boutique hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: JournoLondon
Reviews.Content: Arrived in a taxi (cheap in HK) which is probably best as it is a very busy area although MTR station (Wanchai) only 10 mins walk away. Taxi driver unaware of the hotel and it doesn't look much from the outside being part of an office block. Not a tourist hotspot but turn left outside hotel for MTR and tram and you can walk along a pedestrian walkway to HK Convention Center in about 20 mins, 5 mins further to Wanchai Star Ferry across harbour to Kowloon. Turn right and 10-15 min walk to the Times Square huge shopping mall (with nice restaurants) in Causeway Bay. My room was a JJ Premier (Rm 1205), which was nice and big for HK, with a King bed and bathroom with bath an walk-in shower. Bathroom separated with glass walls, which works well but could provide a privacy issue for some sharers. Once I logged on to the correct connection (there seem to be a few possibilities) the free wi-fi worked fine - a definite attraction in choosing this hotel. In this day and age, all hotels should offer this service. The 12th floor was fine but it smelt cigarette-smokey on the 10th floor. Otherwise clean and modern. The windows open too! Nice wall-mounted TV, shame about the 6 channels on offer. They rent DVDs if you're interested. Bed is very hard. Personally, I wouldn't recommend it with children in tow. McDonalds, Delifrance (in CCU (?) Building across road) and Starbucks, Burger King close by (turn right in parallel main road, 100m, on other side of CCU). Local bakery next door good for cheap bread, croissants and cakes. Having had a few initial reservations about the hotel's situation, it is great value for HK.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - I agree with all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: Sarasota34235
Reviews.Content: I only have a few negatives that haven't been mentioned: Pillows are terrible Towels are thin and one was ripped Don't even think about asking for more There is an air vent on the floor next to the toilet - foul smeeling fumes come out Carpet is dirty - nobody vacuumed in the week I was there. Wear socks or shoes However, it's a great value. I paid 530HKD off of booking.com. I know other people have paid less. Location is good. Supermarket in basement is great. Room is well-designed and fairly large by Hong Kong standards. I had room 1001 - I would ask for it again. Maybe 901, 1101 and 1201 are the same - I don't know. Despite the negatives, I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: IOL7
Reviews.Content: Service- friendly and helpful staff, available 24hrs-reply emails from US within 15mins to 1 hour, they made sure we have fresh towels even we put a "Do not Disturb" sign. Rooms- We stayed in 2 rooms, 1st room with very comfy king sized bed with foam on top of mattress, 2nd room for our 2 daughters with no foams which were too firm for them, both rooms were roomy, liked the flat screen TV, the bathrooms with glass walls were clean with amenities (comb, toothbrush, tooth paste, shampoo, the basics), there were shades if you need privacy, FREE wifi which was very unusual to get with the price we paid for. Location- located on the 9th-12th of a commercial building, no hotel lobby which was fine with us, the security persons at the main lobby were friendly and always opened door for us. Value- very affordable!, Book thru AsiaTravel.com with great rates, no cancellation fees (we did cancel a 3rd room), we paid at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great for Site-Seeing”
Reviews.Author: expdabest
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for about $55 on Agoda.com. The bed was big and very comfortable. The location was exceptional. It is an easy walk to the metro or a tram. Cable TV only has 1 or 2 English channels. I didn't use the internet, but it appears that it wasn't very accessible in the room. I will definitely stay here again, but probably not on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: jsingaporek
Reviews.Content: Got the rooms for a good price online, considering how expensive accommodation is in Hong Kong. Since it occupies a few floors in a building as opposed to the whole building being a hotel, it might be quite hard to spot it among the various signboards sticking out of every corner but having the exact address did help. Located along a main road, place is easily accessible by taxi. The MTR is a short 5-10 min walk, and the location is pretty good. Plenty to eat around the hotel and it's easy to get to all the main areas such as Central and Causeway Bay by MTR. Doorway, reception are quite small but staff were friendly and polite. Room was spacious by Hong Kong's standards and very clean. Not much of a view but that's alright. The shower/washroom is surrounded by a clear glass wall but has blinds which you can draw; best for couples or people you are really comfortable with. It's a small hotel but looks quite modern and clean; more of a business hotel not somewhere you'd go if you want a romantic place or if you're travelling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value!”
Reviews.Author: lirbaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find! We stayed in Hong Kong for 7 nights in September and so many of the hotels we looked at seemed quite expensive but JJ hotel was extremely reasonable (£218 for a double room for 7 nights) so we decided to go for it! The hotel is in a very good location on Hong Kong island, about 5mins walk from Wanchai MTR station. There is a supermarket right outside the hotel, and a few 7 elevens along the road, as well as restaurants and bakeries. There are tram stops and bus stops just minutes down the road too. The hotel is on a busy road but we didn't hear any noise throughout our stay. Check-in was very quick and hassle-free and we were very happy with our room. The room was spacious, very clean and comfortable. The bed was also very big (although only 1 pillow each which was find with us but may be a problem for some). There was a wardrobe with a a safe, tea/coffee making facilities, a fridge, tv and dvd player, free bottles of water and complementary bathroom amenities (shower gel, showercap etc). Worth mentioning as well is that the walls of the bathroom are glass but there are blinds which you can pull down if you like! The restaurant doesn't have a restaurant or bar of it's own, however there is a karaoke bar in the building as well as a restaurant called Megan's Kitchen (we didn't try either). For breakfast most mornings we bought excellent rolls and pastries from a bakery across the road where the staff were very friendly and helpful! The only problem we had with our room during our stay was that one night, the air-conditioning broke - not good when the temperature outside is over 30degrees . Staff came to our room to see if they could fix it that night but unfortunately they couldn't and they couldn't move us to another room as the hotel was full. We had a very uncomfortable night but at 9am the next morning they had maintenance to our room to fix the air-conditioning unit. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay there again. The room has everything you could need for a city break in Hong Kong, it's in a good location and is a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, wet and mouldy”
Reviews.Author: jellybaby_25
Reviews.Content: On entering our room on the 10th floor we were overwhelmed with the smell of dampness. We soon discovered that the carpet was all wet. On exiting our room to explore Hong Kong, we found that the whole floor smelt of mildew (we initally hadn't noticed it), thus we didn't bother asking to change rooms, because it seemed the whole place had a water problem. We tried to keep the windows open during the day to air out the room, but they were always closed by housekeeping. Even the bed (pillows, sheets etc) felt slightly damp, which made it uncomfortable to sleep on, and there was mould through-out the glassed bathroom which just added to our negative feeling for the hotel. However, the location of the hotel was excellent, being within walking distance to the MTR and the ferry pier. But I would not go back to the jj hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: MichaelNieuwegein
Reviews.Content: Yes, JJ hotel is indeed a nice and affordable (price - quality) hotel at a good location (close to the Tramway and on walking distance to all sorts of shops). However, it is a small business hotel (nòt specifically used to deal with small children : eg. no baby cot available), tucked away in an appartment building, on the 7th floor (very small elevator; not for claustrophobics) No fancy lobby but nice modern and quiet rooms with all amenities. Nice soft mattresses and beautiful bathroom ! No breakfast available in the hotel but they offer room service for a reasonable price (although of mediocre quality). The supermarket in the basement of the apartment building is very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, good location”
Reviews.Author: bronekTP
Reviews.Content: I stayed in JJ for 1 night. Located in walking distance from MTR Wang Chai line. Room are quite small but they are comfortable equiped. The hotel is located in 9-12 floor of the Lucky Centre Building. In 5th floor is located restaurant which is OK if you do not want to go out for dinner. The staff was very helpfull with organizing all my activities there. If I am in Hong Kong again I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in HK. No extras but plush & comfortable & best location.”
Reviews.Author: jofeck
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in the JJ.... got great internet deal. Best location possible in HK in my opinion. Only a star ferry ride away from tourist mecca but zero hassle from touts! Wanchai is in 'the thick of the action'! Plenty to do, loads of local eateries and drinking joints. We ate for peanuts every night elbow to elbow with locals so you know you are eating well and for good value. Just walk out the door of JJ and up any side street and you'll find plenty of great authentic eating spots. Pubs are plentiful as well. The JJ rooms are very nice - huge bed (6 footer!) very plush and comfortable. Spotless room and bathroom. The bathroom all glass is a bit of fun and very private if you close the blinds :-). The showers are double size and very powerful and again spotlessly cleaned every day. Flat screen TV, free strong wireless internet in the room. No extras but you just walk outside the door of the hotel for food and drinks (in fact you can get food in the building there is a restaurant in the complex). The JJ is like 2 floors of a tall building.. you never see reception except when you check in and check out! It makes for a very independent stay - we loved it all. We took the cheap airport bus (not shuttle) from the airport for a few dollars - the guy on the bus counter at the airport knew the stop and told where to get off and it was only 5 mins walk. We used the In Town Checkin and High Speed Train for returning to the airport and it was brilliant - highly recommend doing that on the return leg. All in all well recommended for value and location - we totally loved it. (Photos as on the site ... rooms look exactly as on their site).

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: WGee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June for a couple of nights during a Hong Kong stopover. What can I say? This is my sixth or seventh visit to the JJ Hotel and I still think it offers the best accommodation for the category in Hong Kong. The rooms are definitely 4 star - spotlessly clean and with everything you need (flatscreen tv, complimentary bottled water, tea and coffee, fridge, safe, basic bathroom amenities (toothbrush, vanity items, shower gel and shampoo), huge fluffy white towels, huge comfortable beds, good sized rooms, good airconditioning, hot water...). Staff are friendly and welcoming. What's the catch? None really - you simply don't have the 4 star property amenities such as a pool, gym, bell hops or fancy reception. The location in wanchai is excellent - 1 minute's walk from the tram, 7 minutes' walk from the nearest MTR, and a 10 minute (HKD30) ride from the Hong Kong Airport Express train terminal. The one downside for some customers could be the glass walled bathrooms. There are blinds to pull down, but you'd need to be fairly comfortable which your travelling companion to share a room. Wi-fi worked with no problems while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “complete comfort and accessibility”
Reviews.Author: jcahyumae
Reviews.Content: we stayed at jj for 5 days and 4 nights and it was great! the room was crisp clean with new furnitures. hotel staff was friendly, accommodating and helpful. they're complete with everything you need to make your stay comfortable. the bed was big for a queen size, can fit 3 people comfortably. they even made a pseudo vanity table with the wooden platform beside the side table with a mirror behind it. =) i had to admit that i was concerned about the bathrooms having glass walls, but turned out, they have pull-down covers for that, but you can easily hear everything happening inside. the toiletries, tea and complimentary water are replenished daily and they even provide your own water heater and cups. the hotel lobby was clean and the security was good cos before you could enter the hotel rooms, they have a door from the elevator that can only be accessed by your key card. the location is really great, its at the center of everything, the grocery is just within the building, its near the bakery, cafe de coral ( popular restaurant in hk) 7-eleven, stores, tram, subway, mcdonalds, and street foods. the only thing that i didnt like about this hotel is the internet access. its not free =p but its okay cos a computer shop is also near their place =)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaSledge
Reviews.Content: pleasant hotel in the Wanchai district of Hong Kong. Walking distance to train, harbour, restaurants, night life etc

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a low price”
Reviews.Author: LaPF
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JJ Hotel for three nights; got a special promotion (15 Euros pppn!) and it was great. Helpful and polite staff, very spacious clean rooms, nice design, all special extras that you expect from a four star hotel (except breakfast, but that was no problem) - made our stay in HK perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price but room smelled”
Reviews.Author: buzzinlites
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel (has hair dryer but no hair conditioner). It was one of cheapest we found with decent reviews. The check-in area is on the 9th floor and there is no lobby. There are restaurants in the same building, but not part of the hotel. It is close the subway, about 7 minute walk and there is never a lack of taxis. Staying here offers a much more a local feel, as it is not touristy like Tsim Sa Tsui. The only bad thing about my stay was that the room had a mildew smell, which is why I rated it poor. However, the friends I was traveling with, staying in a different room, had no smell in their room. Because I was staying there for 6 nights and the hotel didn’t have any other room available for that long, they weren’t able to switch rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For A Great Room”
Reviews.Author: JetsFan85x
Reviews.Content: As most of the other reviews have suggested, there is quite possibly no better value in Hong Kong then the JJ Hotel. In a city with tremendous amount of things to do the only things my girlfriend and I were looking for were a clean hotel room located in a reasonably good area.Well,I'm happy to report that we received that and more! The hotel rooms were much more spacious then I had expected, extremely modern, and came with amenities such as free wi-fi, bath robe/slippers, and your basic toiletries which some other hotels would make you pay for. Unless you're looking to stay at the Peninsula or a hotel of this kind, staying in place other then the JJ is a disservice to not only you but your wallet as well! Go out and get a custom made suit with the money you've saved!

Reviews.Title: “Do it!”
Reviews.Author: Sens4life
Reviews.Content: Seemed too good to be true. 50 USD a day gets you a modern, fair-sized room (by HK standards) in a great location, a short walk from the Wan Chai MTR station. It is a bit confusing trying to find it for the first time, but once you know where it is it's easy to find after that. Take a taxi the first time then you'll be fine. The free wireless Internet is the fastest I've ever used from a hotel. There is a small grocery store below the hotel, I'd recommend taking advantage of it because my minibar was empty. Staff was helpful but didn't need them much. DVD players in every room and lots of DVDs to borrow, and provided a complimentary copy of China Daily. Wasn't a big fan of the glass walls separating the bathroom from the rest of the room, but it's becoming more common in east Asia. There was a lot of construction going on at the street entrance but that's progress. Should be ranked much higher than 26th.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: cicak23
Reviews.Content: Save your money for the attractions in Hong Kong. JJ Hotel offers a comfortable room at about a third of the price of larger hotels. It's a quick walk to nightlife in Wan Chai, the star ferry that takes you to Kowloon, and a quick walk to the MTR Station. Book your room [--] to get a good deal. Be sure to try their hot pot at Megan's Kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “JJ-4 star comforts at 3 star rates”
Reviews.Author: Minwalla
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at JJ Hotel just last week. Since we were 3 adults on a holiday with 3 kids (aged 5,3 & 3 (twins)), we were nervous about the hotel. However, the staff was most obliging and friendly and the rooms were were scrupulously clean. They graciously loaned us plates and cutlery for the kids, and even provided adaptors for our mobile chargers. Mineral water was provided most generously. Irons were availbale on request, and so were additional pillows and towels. The hotel is situated in the heart of Hongkong on the busy Wanchai Road. This suited us well, as there is a convenient Wellcome grocery store in the basement of the same building, and there are a couple of launderettes on the same street. Buses and trams were freely available and so were taxis (in non rush hours). The MTR station is a 10/12 minute walk. In spite of the busy area, after 10p.m. the street cleared up magically, and quiet would descend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel in Wanchai District”
Reviews.Author: chingtham
Reviews.Content: Hotel Location is not very appropriate if shopping is the main agenda. Need to get familiar with the landmark of the location due to multiple streets leading to the area around the hotel. I got in a cab and asked him to drop me at the hotel from the convention center but I realized I was dropped at the same location after charging me 16 Dollars. The Hotel inside is good very helpful. Except they charge you something in advance and if you wish to pay by card they again charge you when you finally check out. So it is better to asked them to pay not just lock the amount from the card as the money do not get refunded easily from the locked amount as advance. Just pay by cash that's the best thing and if you wish to pay by card tell them to charge and not lock the amount. It took me three months to get the refund of the amount which was locked but while checking out I was charged for the whole stay once again and in the process ended up paying twice and took three months to get the first part I paid. Chinese people still believe in CASH not cards so you are better off paying in cash to save you all the problem after the trip. However I should not forget to mention the staff who are very very friendly and helpful always with a smile

Reviews.Title: “Stay here and spend your budget on food instead!”
Reviews.Author: cheapncheerful
Reviews.Content: We loved the JJ: central location, nice decor, clean, and at an excellent price (HKD450)! Staff spoke good English and were helpful (e.g., helped us find the address of a restaurant that we only knew the name and neighbourhood of). Not far from metro, tram or Wan Chai ferry pier. Lots of food in the area -- we enjoyed breakfast at the Honolulu Cafe near the metro station. Would definitely stay here again. The glass bathrooms are entertaining, too.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable price/quality ratio in HK!”
Reviews.Author: Miica
Reviews.Content: Excellent JJ! Efficient reception staff. Great location, modern, stylish, big enough for 2 room(standard) - comfortable for a traveller who is looking for a little design boutique hotel experience. Nice open views to the hills from the 11th floor(smoking). All the services one can want and imagine incl. I-One internet place within a short walk. It ain't Peninsula for sure but for the price paid(under €50 per night) it's in a league of it's own in HK!

Reviews.Title: “4 STAR Budget price !!!”
Reviews.Author: fortuner13
Reviews.Content: if your looking for a 4 star room only w/o amenities (pool, bars , grand lobby) with affordable price , JJ is the answer, booking is cheaper thru asiatravel.com than official website, we stayed there for 3 nights, room is larger than std room of other hotels, king bed can accomodated 3 person, very clean bathroom, spotless, TV has 8 channels only, It's location is not actually hard to find but the location map in the official website make it more complicated. best route is took an MTR go to WAN CHAI station at exit at A3. once you exit at A3 you are already at JOHNSTON ROAD (not Hennesy roads as stated in website location map), just cross the street, you will see WING LUNG BANK, TURN left then after 400 meters you will reach an intersection of Johnston and wan chai road, Just walk STRAIGHT follow the 7-11 Shop (Do not follow the railroad track), after passing 7-11 about 300 meter you will see another 7-11 store and CAFE DE CORAL at the corner, just walk straight the about 300 meters again you will see welcome store beside is already JJ hotel, if you will took a taxi just tell the taxi CHARTER HOUSE hotel, charter house is also located on the same street/same side , 5 min walk to JJ , the only downside of this hotel is that they don't have a heater on the air conditioned and they dont have a bellboy

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JW1234
Reviews.Content: JJ Hotel is situated in the middle of Wang Chai Road. It is on the 9th, 10th and 11th floor of a building which contains offices and a few restaurants. There really isnt a lobby as such but once you get into your room, it is roomy and extremely clean, Flat screen TV & DVD player, Modern bathroom and shower but it is all glass and so you have to know your partner well ;o) Having said this you can pull the blinds down on all sides. Only 5 minutes from the station. The train service is clean, fast and efficient. Our find was the Irish pub "Delaneys" on Luard street which serves great food and happy hour from 12 noon to 9pm. As we had been travelling alot in Asia, this was a welcome change from rice with every meal. Ideal for a short stay and sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TokyoJoe
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find, hotel reception located on 9th floor. Great value booking via Asiatravel.com, at 420 HKD per night. No frills boutique design hotel, rooms are clean, large comfy king size bed with see thru glass bathroom, although one can draw down the blinds for privacy. rooms also starting to show its age a little. LCD TV and DVD player witha library of films to choose from at reception free of charge, electronic safe, ample bathroom amenities and complimentary bottled water, No breakfast included but try Cafe de Coral 2 minutes walk away, other convenience stores such as 7-11 are nearby. Walking distance to Wanchai nighlife and MTR takes 10 miutes, shopping in Causeway Bay 15 minutes. This hotel is thoroughly recommended for travellers on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: butterrum
Reviews.Content: The JJ hotel is the best possible scenario when travelling to Hong Kong. Given that the city is expensive, this hotel was very affordable relatively. The rooms are huge, clean, with a flat screen TV. Not much choice in terms of channels, however. There is air-conditioning, a safe and a mini-fridge. Just outside the hotel building is the Wellcome market if you need to pick up any snacks or beverages. The beds have memory foam mattresses, making them very comfortable. The bathrooms are encased in glass, but have a draw screen for privacy. We always had hot water for showers. The hotel is close to the Wan Chai MTR and there are buses and trams everywhere. No computers for internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but hard to find”
Reviews.Author: FilipinoBusinessman
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for two this last Chinese New year for only HKD500 a night. Even with the map of the hotel I got from the web, the taxi driver couldn't find the place. We passed the hotel without noticing it. Cafe de Coral and Wellcome Supermarket are better landmarks. It is about 1 km from the Johnston Rd exit of Wanchai MTR station. I noted the glass walled toilet from the reviews. Yes, there are draw down shades but there's almost an inch between them so you can get a really good view. There's no shade on the door side. So you must be pretty intimate with your room mate or comfortable with nudity. My wife and I didn't mind it too much, but it would not be a room to share with your kids. The Flat Screen TV was really nice and it was good to have a small ref and hot water dispenser. They provide free coffee, tea and 2 bottles of water per day. There is a Wellcome supermarket in the basement where you can buy really good fresh fruits and instant noodles. The food in Cafe de Coral is okay but you need to point out your order on the big wall menu unless you speak Mandarin or Cantonese. There is a restaurant called Cafe de Delicious on the ground floor, but we didn't dare try it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Pendragon
Reviews.Content: JJ is a little small but then again, its Hong Kong what do you expect, however.. it was still above average... They change and clean our room everyday with complimentary water (believe you'll need it - its Hot in Hong kOng), fresh towels and etc... The best thing about it is, its about 2 minutes away from McDonalds that delivers 24/7... hahaha... anyways, what ever you see in the pics, its what you get...

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss IT!”
Reviews.Author: Dermenco
Reviews.Content: Lets see why I said so... Location Great location(not for a great view)... 7min walk from your room to Wan Chai MTR station. 1min walk to 2(TWO) 7-elevens and Wellcome Supermarket (working hours till 11pm) just located underground of its building. 2min walk to Mc Donald's(24hours). 7min to KFC(till 10pm only) right opposite of the Wan Chai MTR Station. 2min walk to "Ting-Ting Bus" or we call it trams. 1min walk to Bus Stop for Bus no.111 to HK-Macau Ferry Terminal which costs you about 5.40HKD. 1min walk to Cafe-De-Coral located just above K-mart & 7-eleven (MUST TRY!!) - a chinese fastfood chain store. 5min walk to Causewaybay's Times Square. 15min walk to Convention Centre.(without any misdirection) 7min walk to Toy Street(till 6pm only) just right beside KFC 1min to Chinese Restaurants(opposite or same street). Rooms Wider than normal hotel rooms. I've stayed in Superior Rooms priced at about 500-600HKD per night for a week booked from asiatravel.com as it was cheaper than booking.com and others. It was definitely better than Harbourview Hotel and Dorsettsss. You would not need to put your luggage on top of your bed to get your stuffs. As I had to, in Dorsett(s) - 'which means this hotel is considered spacious for HK land'. I should have found this Hotel earlier! At the first place, I was kinda worried of the pictures shown in tripadvisor. BUT IT WAS FOR REAL! I am not posting any photos as they are exactly what the others had posted. Great design on the Glassy Toilet. Love that. Special and makes me feel that the room is bigger. The room includes: Toilet Amenities, Minibar(empty), two bottles of mineral everyday, LCD TV with 9chanels +a dvd player for your own discs, 4 power points(one for TV), hair dryer, and for others, you may ask from the reception, wireless broadband for free and free daily newspaper. The room condition is very new, clean, bigger than other 3star-4star hotels. People working in this hotels are very helpful and friendly. Tips for you in HK Buy your personal octopus card and travel around including buying stuffs in Markets and Restaurants. For those backpack travelers or student who wishes to save more money on your transfer to the Hotel. Take a Blue Taxi from HK airport to TungChung MTR which costs you about max 50HKD including huge luggages(3) or Bus at 3.50HKD from Airport to TungChung Station. Take Trains to the City by MTR to Wan Chai Station for 18HKD. It would be much cheaper than taking the airport express(60HKD) as TungChung MTR line is traveling alongside the airport express way only that the line will stop in more stations. From airport to JJ hotel will take you about 55minutes including walking time. I took taxi upon my arrival at 330HKD which took me about 35minutes at night. Speak cantonese would not make you a Big Fish to them. Traveling to Macau from the Ferry terminal is at 146HKD(counter) for one-way ticket(afternoon price). But if you buy it from agents, you could get cheaper rates at 140HKD(only in HK) as Macau Terminal has no agents before the counters. I am going for this Hotel again this Summer! Will not miss it! Tres Bien!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: LisaTai
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a modern hotel with a good location to stay at in HK (whilst also working to a budget of £100 per night). The plus points - really good location. It's 5 minutes walk away from Times Square, a large shopping complex with some really good restaurants on floors 10 and above. Its also 10 minutes walk away from Causeway Bay which is the major (modern) shopping district in HK other then Tsim Tsa Tsui. The hotel is also close to the tram station aswell as the Wan Chai MTR station. There are even street stalls of the food variety nearby which open in the evenings. On the downside the walls are thin and it can feel noisy if you are a light sleeper (particularly if your room is in front of the lifts). Having to draw the blinds when using the bathroom was also an annoyance. Of a more minor issue was having to wait a couple of minutes for warm water to come through the showers. I'd avoid this hotel if you are a light sleeper. It's probably more suited to single travellers looking for a great location. If you are staying here make sure you have the hotel's tel number as none of the taxi drivers had heard of this hotel (as it's a very small hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Funky and well located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyFleur
Reviews.Content: JJ Hotel is located in Wan Chai close to Henessy Road trams and 5 mins walk to the nearest MTR station. Hence, it is easy to get to the different shopping and entertainment areas of HK. The rooms are very modern, clean and nicely fitted out. The staff are helpful and the room rates are reasonable. I got a great discount through the RatesToGo web site. Just make sure to ask for a room away from the foyer and elevators. As I arrived late, I was given such a room and heard everyone walking past on the tiled floor to get the elevators. Next morning, I requested a room change. The manager was very accommodating and I was relocated to a nice quiet room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “You got what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: travelDIY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a Deluxe room for 8 nights. The room is small but the king size bed is huge and comfortable. I walked by a Premier room while it was being cleaned, it is a lot bigger if you don't mind spending extra money. The room is simple and clean, just liked what other reviews have described it. Location is ok, about 8 mins walk to the WanChai MTR station and 15 mins or so to Causeway Bay. It is slightly off the main road but still on a very busy street. The area is very local, it is definitely not a tourist area. The free wi-fi internet is a bit slow and most of the time there is no connection at all. Overall, it is good worth of money in terms of room rate and quality. Stay there if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the JJ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elle18
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JJ for 6 nights and we could not fault our stay. We booked through a travel Asia website and got a discounted rate, upon arrival we were upgraded to a Premium room so we got great value for money. The rooms were clean, bright and regularly cleaned. The staff were friendly and helpful and the location was good only a 5-10 minute walk to the MTR with lots to do around the area. We would definately recommend this hotel and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money on HK Island”
Reviews.Author: vanilla_bean
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms and stayed at JJ Hotel for 5 nights and were really happy with the quality and size of the rooms. For people who don't want to stay in a hostel, but don't have a budget for the Intercon or Shangri-La, the JJ Hotel is a suitable compromise. Location wise, it was great -- just 8-10 minutes walk to the Wan Chai MTR station, 10 minute walk the bars of Lockhart road and about 15 minutes to Causeway Bay. The room looks like it does on the website, so there were no surprises in that aspect. The bathroom with the clear glass walls takes getting used to, and by the end of our stay, it became tiresome to keep pulling the blinds up and down. Having said that, it was really a minor inconvenience -- certainly not a deal breaker. We ate out all the time, so we didn't try the room service or the restaurant on the 5th floor nor did we try the free internet. Overall, in terms of location, price and quality, JJ Hotel delivered good value for money -- especially in expensive Hong Kong. I would have no problems recommending the hotel to friends and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “JJ - great price, great service. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: joshuan1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the JJ in November, mostly based on the reviews from others. And I wasn't disappointed. I had stayed previously in HK at the Mandarin Oriental - which was huge and great and all - but very expensive (thanks work!). I got there by taking the Airport express train to central, a 2 stop MTR ride to Wan Chai - and then get out at the A3 exit and cross the road. Head left and it's a 5-8 minute walk. Most reviews say the rooms are quite large for HK - and I really can't comment, as my previous stay was in a large room. It was certainly adequate. The showers/bathroom is clearly unique and there are blinds if it's a problem for you! The staff were fantastic, and were happy to assist with everything. There's no cable TV - that could be a problem for some. The quality of the room service wasn't great either, but I wasn't staying there for that reason. Overall a very pleasant stay and I can thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting and Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dloren00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for the money. The room is modern and very comfortable. It is in a very good location close to downtown and the subway system. I should note that the hotel is hard to find as it is in an office building on a crowded street. This, I've heard, is common for hotels in Hong Kong, but It was the first time that I've seen this. Make sure that you have the full address when you seek out the hotel. I was walking around a bit in the heat looking for it. Also, the bathroom walls are made out of glass. So this means that you can block out the view of the bathroom toilet and shower by pulling down the shades in the bathroom. Also interesting. But please do not be put off by these two notes . . . the hotel was an excellent place to stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cat66hie
Reviews.Content: Was quite happy with JJ hotel. Stayed their with a friend, and were just looking for a place to stay for our last night in Hong kong. The Lucky centre is not a huge landmark in Wanchai, so your taxi driver might not know exactly how to get there. Also, it is a 'centre', so there isn't a lobby or reception on the ground floor, just a security guard/conceirge who isn't that helpful (had to pull our own suitcases). The hotel only take certain level of the building. Room: Every thing is really new, but the room is quite SMALL (had a queen sized bed, and it took up the majority of the room). The bathroom is more of a space next to the bed which is surrounded by glass. You need to pull the blinds down everytime you need to use the toilet which was annoying - plus you should be quite comfortable with your room mate as you can hear everything! There was free wireless which was quite handy, and a small flat screen tv and DVD player. Location: really conveniant - about a 5 min walk to the MTR and right in the middle of Wanchai. There are lots of places to eat, especially nice bread/pastry stores. Service: They have common areas which have a lounge area with complimentary biscuits and tea etc. People at reception were quite helpful in giving advice about using the check in at Airport Express, and quite accomodating when we said we would like to use a boardroom to sort out our luggage after we checked out. But they seemed a little inexperianced (looked like students). For the price I would be very happy to stay again - main good points are the location, and comfort of the room in terms of cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Loved JJ's”
Reviews.Author: CuteCharlie
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 3 night stay at JJ's hotel in Hong Kong. This is an excellent hotel! The location is very good, about a 10 minute walk to Wan Chai metro station. Therefore it is easy to get to the airport using the airport express train, you just need to connect at Hong Kong Central. The rooms are very nice, comfortable and modern. We had a huge bed! The linen used by the hotel is crisp and clean, and the towels are of good quality. The air conditioning is strong, which is very good when you visit Hong Kong as it is a rather hot and humid place. Reception staff are very friendly and helpful. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_england
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a good location. Good rates through www.asiatravel.com. To find the hotel I recommend heading first to the Novetel Century Hotel (marked on the free maps) at the corner of Lockhart Road and Stewart Road in Wan Chai. Head south along Stewart Road (away from the bay) and go up the sidestreet south of the junction between Hennesy Road and Johnston Road. The hotel is across the road on Wan Chai Road. Part of the Lucky Centre building. The bathroom is separated from the bedroom by glass windows, but there are blinds that can be pulled down.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Maria G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. Clean rooms, but not too big (I think it is normal for Hong-Kong). Walking distance from the subway (Whan Chai) station. Booked through asiatravel.com, 90$ per night, breakfast not included

Reviews.Title: “good for the money and not bad too”
Reviews.Author: agrifo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JJ on two occasions and had a good experience the rooms were small but clean and comparatively speaking the average size room for hong kong. The staff is not exactly helpful but they are perfectly nice, one just has to ask for their help if you know what I mean, the hotel is located on floors 9 - 12 and the reception is on 9 so that means on some days you do not meet the staff, if you are not in need this is a good thing. The JJ is in a very central location between causewaybay and admirality (central) the neighborhood is safe and friendly. Overall I think it was a great value and it provided everything we needed, wifi, a clean room and a big bed. Beware, most of the hotels in Hong Kong are freezing cold, the JJ is not an exception, in the summer this is OK in the winter it is not, heat is not a standard in the summer but a/c is! As the other reviewers I would recommend the JJ and for sure stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Glassy....”
Reviews.Author: sw20_og
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to HK and after several days of research I settled for the JJ Hotel. It was in my price range and since I couldn't find any negative reviews I decided to go with them. I booked a deluxe room thru Asiatravel.com and their rates were much lower than JJ's published rate. First of all it was a little difficult to locate due to the disorienting Wan Chai Road. It parallels Johnston Road but also intersects with it. Even with a printout from Google Maps it was still a task finding it walking from the Wan Chai MTR station. There is signage for the hotel but very small so you have to keep your eyes open. Once you find it, it's a piece of cake getting back to the MTR. A 10-minute walk on average and not the 5-8 as advertised. Room was very clean with a simplistic Japanese feel to it. No dirty bedspreads to worry about since all you have is a comforter. The mattress was very firm but comfortable. Had all the amenities we needed including free wi-fi. One weird thing was their all glass bathroom. If you like to watch each other make toilet or take a shower then this is your dream come true! There are pull down blinds to cover the glass but it doesn't give total coverage and there is no lock on the door. Very interesting. Don't be surprised when you're not greeted with warmth and a smile. I stayed there for 5 nights and didn't see one smile from their staff. I'm not sure if it's their culture not to smile but I found it very discourteous. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice find on HK island”
Reviews.Author: JClinton
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th stay in Hong Kong and my first on the Island itself. I usually stay at the YMCA Salisbury on Kowloon side. I really enjoyed my three days at the JJ Hotel. The modern & clean room was big enough. There was a wardrobe and room to walk around the bed. Free wifi is included (they even had a USA electric adaptor in the outlet). There are 7 channels on the flat screen. Free local calls. There is no laundry for guest use. There is a laundry service a few blocks away. I paid 2210 HKG total for three nights in a Superior room using Asia Travel. The hotel does not have a ground floor lobby. You take the elevator up to the 9th floor. It’s only a 5 minute walk from exit A3 of the Wan CHai MTR station. The only negative may be a deal breaker for some people. The bathroom has 100% GLASS walls! The only privacy between the bedroom & the bathroom is three pulldown shades that don’t cover all the glass.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: jansku
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and enjoyed very much. At 60 eur/night great value for brand new and clean although small room for such excellent location - MTR, McDonald's, 7eleven and shops 300 meters away!

HotelInfo.Name: JJ Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lucky Centre, 165-171 Wanchai Road, Hong Kong, China
